loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 37 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. Merlinda earns a living from her sari-sari store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately PHP 9,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. Merlinda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to engage in the rice "palay" trading business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en: Saturnino is a businessman from Cebulin, Plaridel. He is 41 years old, married and has expertise in selling. He runs a sari-sari store and earns a good income that sufficiently supports his family. Saturnino is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. Now, he applied for a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other assorted items to sell, to meet his customers' demand. Saturnino continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the determination to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other assorted items to sell, to meet his customers' demands

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a rural farmer who does both livestock and crop farming on a relatively small scale. Charles buys baby bulls that he feeds on fodder for 3-6 months and then when they have fattened, sells them to butchers at a profit. 

Charles anticipates the sales to be high this festive season. This is the reason he is asking for a loan to buy stock of these bulls so that he can sell at a profit. He is hardworking and hopes to acquire more loans from UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy baby bulls to sell

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl works hard to support her family. Sheryl is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Sheryl has been in this business for seven years now.

She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Sheryl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene works hard to support her family. Mylene is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Mylene has been in this business for one year now.

She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like noodles, meat, and vegetables. In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like noodles, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a married man with four young children from Dulag, Leyte. His oldest child is 13 and the youngest is 2. He is a fish vendor. He sells fresh fish to the nearby community to earn a living, using his motorcycle as a mode of transportation. 

Edwin is asking for a loan to purchase a variety of fresh fish to re-sell. This will help Edwin to sell more varieties of fresh fish and possibly attract more customers. This will help to increase his sales, providing his family with nutritious diets and a better shelter to live.

In the future, Edwin dreams to expand his business to make it productive and profitable, and to be able to finance the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
For the last four years, Gladys has been selling fish, and earns a monthly income of KES.16,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is married to Morris and is blessed with three school-going children.

She has applied for her sixth loan of 20,000 KES from ‘Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more fish to sell. 

Gladys will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita has always had enthusiasm for doing her gardening activities, from which she earns a promising income, helping her husband in support of their family. She busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She never stopped pursuing her goals for the good of the family. 

Anacorita grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers for her growing crops. In the future, Anacorita wishes to own a motorcab for easy transport of her produce.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en:
Jacques is 26 years old and is not married. He has a motorcycle transport business and has been working for 3 years. 

With the loan, Jacques would like to buy spare parts for repairing his motorcycle. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a motorcycle mechanic in Eldoret town and has been in this business for four years. He also sells cereals and it has been profitable. He is 34 years old, married and, together with his spouse, has been blessed with two children aged 4 and 3 years old. He also supports four members of his family. 

He will use this loan to boost his cereals business by buying more cereals such as maize and beans to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to renovate his house so it will be in good condition. 

This is his second loan term from VisionFund Kenya. He paid his previous loan successfully. In the future, he hopes to be self reliant and provide a quality education for his children.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Kan Gyi Kone Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Kan Gyi Kone Village, Myanmar in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five Community Based Organization (CBO) members oversee a group of 24 village customers (8 males, 14 females). This loan will help some group members purchase young, less costly ducklings while providing funds until the ducks grow and lay eggs after four months. Other group members will use funds to buy high-quality feed for ducklings ($70 per month for 100 ducklings). Kan Gyi Kone Village has over 1,000 villagers; most of the men are farmers.  For additional income, some households also have small grocery stores at their home, and raise pigs, ducks and chickens.

The picture above shows four CBO members: Daw Cho, Daw Chaw, Daw Yee and Daw Thae. Included in the picture, Daw Cho (second from left) is 47 years old and a housewife. She is blessed with four children, some of whom are in school. Her husband farms at their 14-acre crop farm. Daw Cho takes care of 120 ducks and 300 ducklings. They also raise 9 pigs and 15 chickens. Proximity's loan will enable her to buy 300 ducklings (costing $200) and to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings and high-quality feed

loans.name: Lynnife

texts.en:
Lynnife works hard to support her family. Lynnife is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Lynnife has been in this business for six years now.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. 

Virgie wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce and noodles. In the future, she hopes to build a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 43 years old, married and lives in Lopez Jaena. She runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of their family.

Jean is driven by a passion in selling. Everyday she patiently tends her store until evening. Jean wants to expand her business; she recently signed up her membership in Paglaum MPC to access insurances and financial assistance. Now, she has borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and those of the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Yosuf

texts.en:
Yosuf is a 33-year-old married man and a father of two children, living with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. The oldest child is 6 years old and the youngest one is 3 years old. 

Yosuf has a University education but due to high rates of unemployment in the country, Yosuf couldn't find a job to look after his family. He decided to start his own business selling electrical and construction materials in a small store in the area where he lives. This humble business is the sole source of income for Yosuf and his family, which is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. His capital is small because he doesn't have enough materials to face the needs of his customers. To expand his business more, Yosuf applied for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase electrical and construction materials for his store to be able to attract a lot of customers.

Yosuf hopes to open another store beside the first one to expand his business more.

loans.use: to purchase electrical and construction materials for his store to be able to attract a lot of customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah. He lives with his family in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also bought a rickshaw two years ago to transport goods within the local market. He buys the products from the wholesalers and redistributes it at higher prices.

Mohammad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay for the rest of the rickshaw so he can own it. This will help him to pay part of his urgent expenses.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of the rickshaw so he can own it fully.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 63 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children, who are now adults. 

Patricia has been engaged in farming, particularly coconut growing for eight years, and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month from this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in re-acquiring a parcel of pawned cocoland. Patricia has been a member of PMPC for eight years. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her activities to other nearby towns.

loans.use: to be used in re-acquiring a parcel of pawned cocoland.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: La señora Lizbeth es madre soltera con un hijo a su cargo que aún es muy pequeño. Su domicilio actual se encuentra ubicado en Punata del departamento de Cochabamba. Con mucho esfuerzo llego a concluir el bachillerato. Lizbeth aún es un persona joven y poco a poco va creciendo económicamente, recientemente adquirió un pequeño terreno donde poco a poco va construyendo su hogar, por ahora vive en casa de su madre sin costo alguno junto a sus hermanos menores. Lizbeth se dedica al comercio de carbón  y  a la venta de helados en el mercado, ahora requiere un crédito para ampliar su negocio y comprar más mercadería (carbón) para la venta y así generar mejores ingresos económicos en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en: Lizbeth is a single mother in charge of her son, who is still very young. Her current address is located in Punata, in the area of Cochabamba. With a lot of effort she managed to finish high school. Lizbeth is still a young woman, and little by little she is growing economically. She recently acquired a small piece of land where little by little she is building her home. For now, she lives in her mother’s home at no cost, together with her younger brothers. Lizbeth works in the sale of charcoal, and also the sale of ice cream in the market. Now she needs a loan to expand her business and buy more merchandise (charcoal) for sale, and generate better income to benefit her family.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy merchandise (charcoal) for sale, and generate better economic income to benefit her family.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39 years old and widowed with 6 children. She sells clothes in Mombasa town and has been in this business for 2 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business, make more income and be successful.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es:
Yecenia, de 35 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea desempeñarse como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros, en el municipio de Puerto Boyaca.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de sus hijos, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de calzado al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Yecenia, 35, is very certain of what she wants for her life; and she is determined to complete her studies in order to get ahead and have a good life.

She wants to sell various merchandise—clothes, accessories such as wallets, cosmetics, and similar items, in the municipality Puerto Boyacá. She wants to get started in this occupation because she is eager to earn the income that is necessary for supporting herself and her children and for contributing to her household expenses.

She is a very disciplined, enterprising woman.  She is requesting a loan to purchase a wide variety of wholesale footwear.  In this way, she can take advantage of the opportunity to be independent that Interactuar is giving her; and she hopes to be able to progress as a businesswoman and have a more stable income.

She thanks all the people who may be able to contribute to her dream.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of wholesale footwear.

loans.name: Marie Xavera

texts.en:
Marie Xavera is 50 years old. She is married with four children aged between 9 and 28 years, two of them go to school.  

She has a shop and has been in the business for 25 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en: Felicite is 55 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 22 and 33 years, all of whom are married. She has a shop and has been running her business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, rice and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Peron

texts.en: Peron is a 17-year-old freshman studying electric engineering at university in the city. He is from Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. His widowed mother is a farmer and she also sells porridge and Khmer noodles to the villagers. Because Peron lacks finances to pay his tuition fees for his first and second year, he has decided to secure a loan. With this loan, he will be able to go through the first and second year successfully. After graduation, he hopes to have a good job earning decent salary to help his mother. He also wants to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia earns a living by engaging in rice retail business. She sells rice to the people in her community. She is a married woman with six children from  Dulag, Leyte. Three of her children are still attending school. Her husband is a farmer. He engages in farming, to help defray the family's expenses. 

Rosalia is asking for a loan to buy several sacks of rice to re-sell. With more rice, she could sell higher volumes of rice and also cater to more customers. Eventually, this will help Rosalia improve her sales, and enable her to provide for the basic needs of her children such as healthy diets, better shelter, clothing and to able to finance the education of her children.

Rosalia is determined that someday she will be successful in managing her business to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.es: Belinda tiene 33 años y una hija de 9 años que cursa el cuarto de primaria Belinda es una cocinera y se dedica a elaborar salteñas (empanadas rellenas con carne de res o de pollo, tamaño pequeño, muy populares en Bolivia y recomendables para los turistas) y tambien tiene una tienda de barrio, Belinda prepara las salteñas por la noche y desde las 6 de la mañana se dedica al horneado, su pequeña hija es una ayudante vivaz Belinda quiere un credito para comprar insumos como harina, azucar, manteca y otros A futuro Belinda sueña con tener casa propia
texts.en: Belinda is 33 years old and has a daughter who is 9, who is studying fourth grade at primary school. Belinda is a cook, and she works in the elaboration of salteñas (empanadas filled with beef or chicken, small sized, very popular in Bolivia and recommended to tourists). She also has a neighborhood shop. Belinda prepares the salteñas at night, and from 6 in the morning she does the baking. Her small daughter is a lively helper. Belinda wants a loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, and others. For the future, Belinda dreams of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as flour, sugar, butter, and others.

loans.name: Calvince

texts.en:
Calvince has a tailoring business which he has been running for close to 5 years. He is 27 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of textile materials to use in his tailoring business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This will be his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to become a successful businessman and also improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of textile materials.

loans.name: Maryjo

texts.en: Maryjo is 18 years old from Magassi Cabagan, Isabela. Her parents earn an income from farming and this income is sometimes not enough especially for school fees. This is why she wants to avail herself an education loan of PHP 150,000 from the KIVA lenders which she will use to pay her tuition fees.  Maryjo is taking up BS Accounting Technology. She wants to finish her studies to help her family out of poverty and also give back to those people who helped her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch, a farmer living in Kampot province, is 55 years old. To earn a living, she grows rice and raises animals as her main source of income. She also works for others, for a fee, to supplement her income. She has been involved this business for a long time and earns her about 27,200 KHR per day. This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions in a healthy way.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Immer Josue

texts.es:
Immer, de 23 años de edad, estudio solo cuarto grado, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres a quienes ayuda económicamente,. 

Immer, se dedica a hacer pan, ya tiene más de 8 años de tener panadería, el aprendió como hacer pan cuando comenzó a trabajar en una panadería como ordenanza, debido a que el sueldo como ordenanza era muy poco, él tomó la decisión de aprender a elaborarlo, fue así como poco a poco fue aprendiendo y perfeccionando la técnica, hasta que decidió poner su propia panadería.

Inicio la panadería solo con un empleado y un horno pequeño.- La demanda fue creciendo y tuvo que contratar más personal y hasta el día de hoy tiene 8 empleados y un horno bastante grande.- Él es quien coordina todo en el trabajo.

Immer, tiene la panadería en su casa y sus hermanos se involucran con el trabajo; el horario es de las 12:30 a.m. a 12:00 p.m. la jornada laboral es bastante pesada.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar ladrillos, cemento, tierra y pagar la mano de obra, para construir un nuevo horno, ya que el que tiene no da abasto a la demanda que tiene. Con este nuevo horno Immer, podrá producir más pan y generar mayores ingresos.

Immer, sueña con poder exportar pan a diferentes lugares de nuestro país y fuera de nuestras fronteras.
texts.en:
Immer, who is 23 years old, only studied until fourth grade, he is single and lives in the house of his parents, whom he helps economically. 
Immer’s occupation is to make bread, he has had a bakery for over 8 years. He learned how to make bread when he started to work in a bakery as an assistant. Because the salary as an assistant was very low, he made the decision to learn how to make bread. It was in this way that little by little he began to learn and to perfect the technique, until he decided to open his own bakery.
He opened the bakery with only one employee and a small oven. Demand started to grow and he had to hire more staff. To this day he has 8 employees and quite a large oven. He is the one who coordinates all the work. 
Immer has the bakery at home and his brothers help out with the work. The schedule is from 12:30 a.m. until 12:00 p.m. The working day is quite tiresome. 
The loan will be invested to buy bricks, cement, soil and to pay the workers to build a new oven, because the one he has is insufficient to meet the demand. With this new oven, Immer will be able to make more bread and generate a bigger income. 
Immer dreams of being able to export bread to different places in our country and outside our borders.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, soil, and to pay the workers to build a new oven, because the one he has is insufficient to meet the demand.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is 51 years old and lives in Jimenez-Nacional, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now adults. Cherry has been engaged in managing her sari-sari store business for 24 years already. She is also engaged in a mango production and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month and helps her husband in providing for their family's needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable products for her sari-sari store business. Cherry has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Cherry hopes to expand her sari-sari store and acquire more land in which she will plant mangoes and other fruits to help add to their family's assets and income.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Zarifa is a hardworking woman. She was born in a rural area. She is married. She has four children. Her husband is in construction. She is a responsive and honest woman. She is a teacher of Tajik language and literature. She likes her work and does it well. She does not earn enough money to refresh her house. She is planning to recondition her house. She is asking for financial support to make a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw to use in his business.

loans.name: Yuresmi  Jhoan

texts.es:
Motivada por el deseo de contribuir a su sociedad, Yuresmi de 21 años de edad, decidio emprender su carrera en el área de enfermería.  Considera que ella es un elemento de gran aporte a quienes mas lo necesitan. Actualmente asiste a la universidad y desea obtener un préstamo para pagar los transmites de titulo profesional y los modulos. De esta manera podrá continuar con sus estudios y lograr alcanzar sus metas.
Entre sus planes está absorber el mayor conocimiento posible de esta preparación, ya que después de finalizarlo planea buscar un trabajo que le permita ayudar a su familia. También desea seguir siendo una joven emprendedora en su sociedad  e incentivar el deseo de servicio en las futuras generaciones. Yuresmi es lo que se considera una joven con sueños de alto vuelo.
texts.en:
Motivated by the desire to contribute to society, Yuresmi, who is 21 years old, decided to start a career in the field of nursing. She considers herself to be an element of great assistance to those who are in need. Currently she attends university and she wants to obtain a loan to pay for the procedures of her professional degree and the modules. In this way, she will be able to continue with her studies and be able to achieve her goals. 
Her plans are to absorb as much knowledge as possible during this preparation, because after finishing, she plans to look for a job that will allow her to help her family. She also wants to be able to continue being a young, enterprising woman in society, and incentivize the desire to serve in future generations. Yuresmi is what can be considered as a young woman with high-flying dreams.

loans.use: to pay for the procedures of her professional degree and the modules.

loans.name: Poeng

texts.en:
Poeng, aged 29, is a lovely father of four children who are currently in school. He lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he has been working as construction worker since 2000. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day. 

Poeng is living in an old house and he wants to build a comfortable one for his family. Due to the shortage of his budget, he is now applying a KIVA loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as bricks, cement, iron, stone, timber and sand to build a new house. Through this loan, he hopes he can experience living in a comfortable house. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build a house.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40 years old and is from Baggao, Cagayan. She is married and blessed with four children. 

Having farming as the source of income is kind of difficult for them because it is seasonal. It is a struggle for them to send their daughter, Karen to school. That’s why they want to borrow an education loan of PHP 150,000 from KIVA lenders which they will use for her tuition fees. Karen uses poverty as a drive to be successful in the future. She sees the difficulties as a challenge to be surpassed and triumphed upon. She is hopeful that lenders will approve their loan for this will help them achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 66 years old and is married with three adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 30 years. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got their own jobs. 

She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionisio es casado y tiene siete hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San Juan de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudio solo hasta la primaria y actualmente trabaja como albañil por más de diez horas realizando todo tipo de trabajos en construcción ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y servicios básicos de su familia siendo el único que contribuye en la parte económica de su familia.
En esta ocasión Dionicio quiere un credito para la refaccion de su casa, lo que sucede es que la subita aparicion de lluvias ha empezado a deteriorar ciertos lugares de su vivienda, por eso Dionicio quiere comprar materiales como cemento, fierro, arena y otros para que el trabajo empiece lo más pronto posible Como pueden ver en la fotografia, los muros de adobe no son muy resistentes
texts.en:
Dionisio is married and has seven children who are school age; they all live in his own house occupying three rooms. The house is located in the city of La Paz’s San Juan zone. 

He only went to elementary school and currently works in construction more than ten hours doing all types of construction jobs since he has to cover food, education and basic utility costs for his family and he’s the only income earner in his family. On this occasion he needs the loan to repair the house due to damage caused by sudden rains that have damaged certain areas, so he wants to buy materials such as cement, iron, sand and other items for the work he will begin as soon as possible.  As seen in the photograph, the adobe walls are very resistent.

loans.use: refaccion de su casa

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 32-year-old married mother of two children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, two years ago she started working as a tutor to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved kids.

Hala is a sacrificing mother who is trying hard to provide her family with better living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to cover her dental treatment expenses. This loan is very important to Hala for it will cure her pain.

Hala wishes to get well soon, as she hopes to open her own tutor center in the future to stay capable of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to cover her dental treatment expenses.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim aged 34 is a responsible mother living in Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to meet all the household expenses with their low earnings. Her husband has been changing the nature of his business according to weather. He has now decided to sell fish which is very expensive. He does not have cash in hand to buy fish because the prices of fish have inflated in the last year. 

Therefore, Shamim has requested a Kiva loan for her husband, so that he can buy fish to carry on his business. She is very impressed with your honorable support. She thanks Kiva and Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Shamim's husband to buy fish for reselling.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is 38 years old and is married with five children, living with them in Haja city, Yemen. 

A long time ago, he started building a house with a kitchen and a few rooms. That house is not ready to live in because there is not a hall and bathroom for the house. Ramzi works hard to prepare the house for living in but his income doesn't allow him to do that. As a result, Ramzi applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB to purchase iron steel, cement, bricks and other construction materials to build a hall and bathroom for the house.

Ramzi looks forward to seeing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase iron steel, cement, bricks and other construction materials to build a hall and bathroom for the house.

loans.name: Saymun Group

texts.en:
This group is called Saymun. It consists of five women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 290,000 YER from AMB.

Afia is the leader of the group. She is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children, living with her family in a rented house in a poor area. In her house, Afia has an old oven which doesn't work well and consumes a lot of gas in a short time. Afia wants to change it for a new one but she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase a new oven for the house.

Afia looks forward to having her own house to live in and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven for the house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man and a father of four children. He lives with them in Haja city, Yemen. 

Ali is the sole breadwinner of his family but his income is not enough to cover the daily needs of the family. He decided to purchase a motorcycle to work on as a driver to transport people. Ali believes this transportation well be very profitable for him, but he doesn't have enough money. As a result, he applied for a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a motorcycle to work on as a driver.

Ali hopes to improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to work on as a driver.

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.en:
Sadokat is a strong woman. She was born in 1987, and is married with five children. They live in a village and her husband works in agriculture. She is a countrywoman. 

Sadokat wants to help to her husband, and she is planning to start her own business in agriculture. She has decided to buy livestock and keep them. 

Sadokat is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy livestock to start her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock for starting her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food materials such as canned foods, soft drinks and other things for his grocery store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora Lucia es una persona mayor de estado civil soltera vive con su pareja y a su cargo tiene seis dependientes económicos que son sus hijos, alcanzo estudiar solo hasta el nivel primario por diversas razones, su actividad principal es prestar servicios de gomería y fabricación de abarcas, su lugar de trabajo es la misma comunidad donde vive junto a su pareja en la provincia de Tiraque, actualmente la señora solicita un crédito para la compra de una nueva compresora porque está abriendo otro taller de gomería en el trópico de esa manera lograra mejorar sus ingresos económicos y por lo tanto la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Lucia is an elderly person who is single and lives with her common-law husband.  She has six children who are dependent on her.  She only has a primary education for several reasons.  Her main business activity is providing rubberization services and manufacture of sandals.  She works from home in the province of Tiraque.  The loan she is requesting is to buy a new compressor because she wants to open a new rubber workshop in the tropics.  This way she can earn more income and improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new compressor to open a new rubber workshop, to improve income and family lifestyle.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: Shahlo is an honest woman. She was born in a rural area. She is married and has two children. Her husband left her two years ago. She works in a hospital as a nurse. She works hard, but her wages are not enough for their living expenses. She has decided to work additionally to supplement her income. She wants to open her own business of keeping livestock. She needs financial support to buy livestock for starting her new business. She wants to make a better her life.

loans.use: to buy livestock for her new business.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según ella le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de La Dorada, con el cual planea sostener a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos y su esposo.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar un enfriador y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, granos, galletas y otros alimentos para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de una Colombiana con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
In her search for a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, Maria decided to start a business that would give her everything she had dreamed about.  She will set up a grocery store in her home in the town of La Dorada where she plans to earn enough to support her family: two children and her husband.

Her main difficulty is the lack of work capital.  To get what she needs she is requesting a loan through Corporación Interactuar to buy a refrigerated display case and a variety of basic products including groceries, gains, cookies and other foods to begin her business.

Help these Colombian entrpreneurs with a loan today!

loans.use: To buy a refrigerated display case and basic staples such as groceries, grains and cookies.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 37 years old. She is married with one child who is 11 years and school-going. She sells chickens and has been in this business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more chickens to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to resell.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a 54-year-old lady, living with her spouse and three children in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. Her children have reached the age of marriage. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her three sons have been driving auto rickshaws for many years. Their income is sufficient to feed the entire family. One of her sons has to repair his auto rickshaw but he does not have a sufficient amount to fix the problem. Therefore, Aziz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son will be able to fix his auto rickshaw.

She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings until the time of her children's marriages. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 58 years old. She is married with nine children aged between 12 and 35 years, six of them go to school.  

She sells domestic animals and has been in the business for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more goats and sheep to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
This is Vera or ‘summer’ in English, a 37-year-old villager who’s been photographed in front of their animal stable with her adorable two kids; she’s got four in total, ranging in age from 2 to 13 years old.

Vera is requesting this loan to build a roof for their family house that has been covered with cardboard for some time now. The cold in their region has started long ago; thus, it has been difficult for the family members live in a house under such conditions especially with these little children.  

Vera raises livestock for a living; she has fifteen goats and she sells approximately ten baby goats in the month of June each year. Her husband works in construction.

loans.use: to build a roof for their family house.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 53 years old, married, and a resident of Lopez Jaena, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold at the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years. 

Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. In March 2014, both Nora and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to borrow a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings. She has now applied a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience and diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement and wood to make the necessary extensions for his house.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 28-year-old married mother of one child and a Palestinian refugee. Due to the low social and financial situation of her husband, she started  tutoring from her house three years ago, to help her husband in cover the needs and expenses of their family.
Samia is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua as she is pregnant and wants to buy necessary goods for her new baby and pay her childbirth expenses.

loans.use: to buy necessary goods for her new baby and pay her childbirth expenses.

loans.name: Adli

texts.en:
Adli is a 27-year-old married man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city.  He lives with his wife and two kids in a humble house.  He works as an employee in a local factory where he gets a low income. Adli would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the necessities.  
Adli requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home. By taking this loan, Adli will be able to provide hot water for his family without using electricity. 
Adli appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 46-year-old married woman, from the village Kldeeti. She lives with her husband and father-in-law, who gets a monthly pension from the local government. The family generates income from agricultural activities. They own a plot of agricultural land, a vineyard and cow for milking. Lia and her husband sell milk products and grapes at the local market. However they don't have any significant income to cover even their basic needs and live in normal conditions. Due to their situation, Lia decided to start another activity to generate additional income. 
She requested a loan from local financial institutions but was rejected several times, as the organizations didn't find enough family income to be able to approve the loan request. The start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 1000 GEL to start a trading business. Lia will purchase stocks of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell at price mark-ups in her community. 
The loan will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, as their income will significantly increase thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: start a business selling clothes for additional income.

loans.name: Candelaria Maria

texts.es:
Candelaria es una mujer con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de preparación y venta de comidas rapidas en un pequeño carro de comidas en el municipio de Bello. 
Es una joven muy aplicada pues estudia y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de un carro de comidas y surtido de ingredientes para la preparación de estos alimentos.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su madre todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una joven emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Candelaria is a woman who has all the necessary energy and will to face the world and be better.

Candelaria wants to start a business preparing and selling fast food from a small cart in the municipality of Bello.

Candelaria is a very dedicated young woman: she studies and wants to get ahead and have a profession.

Candelaria is applying for a loan to buy a food cart and ingredients to prepare meals.

With this loan, Candelaria can achieve her dream of being independent and can provide her mother with everything that she needs. In addition, Candelaria can pay for her studies and make progress thanks to support from Kiva and Corporación Interactuar.

Support the work of a young Colombian entrepreneur!

loans.use: to buy a food cart and ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Jhon Juvenal

texts.es:
Jhon es un humilde trabajador residente en el municipio de Apartado con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Es padre de 1 hijo por el cual siempre tuvo el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la venta y distribución de pescado, estos alimentos los transporta en una carretilla y los vende de manera ambulante.

De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son las fuertes lluvias y el alto costo del pescado en algunas temporadas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de pescado para aumentar su oferta y poder tener un mejor inventario en esta temporada de fin de año, así podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Jhon is a humble worker who lives in the municipality of Apartado. He lives a life overflowing with dreams, hopes and the greatest wishes for his family.

Jhon is father to one son. Jhon is always responsible and tries to make his son's life as good as it can be.

Today Jhon earns a living selling fish. He transports the food in a cart and sells it in the street.

One of the biggest difficulties in Jhon's work is the heavy rains, and the high cost of fish during some seasons.

Jhon is applying for a loan in order to buy fish to increase sales. He also wants to have better stock for the end-of-year season. With this loan, Jhon will have enough income to continue with his business and support his family.

loans.use: to buy fish to increase sales.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Badeya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Sossorobougou de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et ont au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Habillement, fruits et légume, produits cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Aichata qui est un membre du groupe Badeya, assise au bout  à droite est une vendeuse Pièces de pagnes et Habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Pièces de pagnes et Habits en quantité et en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché.    
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Badeya comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Aichata compte réaliser  160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en: Badeya is a group of women from the Sossorobougou neighborhood in the city of Koutiala who know each other well and live in big, traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are on average 39 years old and have at least two children. This group of women sell diverse products, such as clothing, fruits and vegetables, cosmetic products, and others. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to integrate Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their second group loan. Aichata, who is a member of the Badeya group, sitting to the far right, sells pieces of pagnes (traditional wraparounds) and clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy pieces of pagnes and clothing gradually in quantity and quality, which she sells at retail to a diverse clientele. She gets her merchandise at the market. While the other Badeya group members foresee earning an average profit of 150,000 FCFA each during the loan cycle, Mrs. Aichata foresees earning 160,000 FCFA. On top of repaying the loan, they use a part of the revenue to pay for personal expenses and to increase their business funds. They hope to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that stocks won't be rare.

loans.use: to buy pieces of pagnes (traditional wraparounds) and clothing

loans.name: Jale

texts.en:
Jale is a 38-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her husband is a master . He was not able to find work in their region, and had to travel in order to feed his family. Jale and her children live in the Agdas region. She raises her children alone. She is a housewife, but she works with livestock breeding at home. In her free time from household work, Jale works in the livestock yard. She does not have a lot of livestock, because she spent a lot of time with her children earlier. 

Currently all her children go to school, and Jale has a lot of time. She decided to not waste this time. She decided to apply for a loan and increase the number of livestock and her income from the livestock breeding business.

loans.use: to increase the number of livestock.

loans.name: Amthal

texts.en:
Amthal is a 29-year-old single man from Deir El Balah city. He lives with his parents in a small simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for his family. Amthal would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the necessities to do so. 
Amthal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home. By taking this loan, Amthal will be able to provide hot water for his family without using electricity. 
Amthal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children, one of whom is currently in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Liza has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Liza has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell like oranges, apples, bananas, etc.

Liza has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.en: Sharifjon is a hardworking man. He was born in 1979. He lives in a rural area and is married with two children. His wife is a sewer. He works as a taxi driver and has had this business for eight years.  Sharifjon started his business with the help of his grandfather.  First he had agriculture business and kept livestock. Now he drives a car and does a taxi business. From his income, he keeps some money for renovating his house. Sharifjon is asking for financial support for better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es un padre muy responsable de 2 hijos, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar un congelador y así poder almacenar los huevos de una manera más eficiente para la venta.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Rigoberto también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a very responsible father to two children. He has had to face many difficulties in life but has always had the strength to get ahead and continue moving forward with his family.

Some time ago, Rigoberto started his own business selling eggs. To do this work, he owns a large number of hens for the business.

Rigoberto dreams of seeing his business expand and knows that, with the help of Corporación Interactuar and those supporting his work, he can do it.

For this reason, Rigoberto is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy a freezer. This will allow him to store the eggs more efficiently for sales.

Doing this will result in a considerable increase in sales, his business will grow and Rigoberto will be able to get ahead.

Rigoberto would also like to own a big business where he can use all of his knowledge to get ahead and offer his children a financially stable future.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Ancizar De Jesus

texts.es:
Ancizar es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 46 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee un cultivo de café, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del municipio de Sonsón, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 2 hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Ancizar manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de Ancizar Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Ancizar is a humble and hard-working peasant of 46 years of age. Since he was young he has learned about all types of work done in the fields from to his father.

Ancizar currently has a coffee plantation. After his harvests are collected, they are sold in the municipal market of Sonsón and earn Ancizar sufficient income to support his household and cover his wife's and children's basic needs.

Ancizar is applying for this loan in order to buy farming supplies in bulk, such as manure, pesticides and fertilisers. Having this products will allow Ancizar to continue looking after his crops and to improve his yield at the next harvest. This will result in a higher income from sales.

Ancizar says that his biggest wish is to continue fighting for financial stability and to provide his family with better living conditions and well-being.

Ancizar can continue to look after his crops and get ahead in life with your help!

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in bulk, such as manure, pesticides and fertilisers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 26 years old. He is single and determined to have a prosperous life.

Samuel sells building materials, a business which he has operated for the last year earning a monthly income of Kshs. 275,000

Samuel has requested for his 2nd loan with VisionFund Kenya an amount of Kshs. 45,000 which he will us to buy to buy sand, ballast, metal rolls and nails among other building material supplies. 

With the anticipated profits, Samuel will be able to restock his business further. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy sand, ballast, metal rolls and nails among other building material supplies.

loans.name: Zare

texts.en:
Zare has been photographed with her 25-year-old son, Erion who has being feeling sick for some time and needs some sort of treatment.  He finished his studies at a university licensed by the previous government, however it was later found that the criteria for a license was never met and the university was closed down.  People like Erion have spent their money and time on degrees which will never be recognized, which (according to him) is not their fault.  After what happened, he started suffering from health issues.  The loan that his mother Zare is requesting from Kiva lenders will be used for his treatment. 

Zare is 49 years old, married and has three children; Erion, and two others who are 20 and 16 years old. She works in a nearby bakery while her husband is receiving a disability pension.  He worked for long time in the mining industry where he started having health problems.

loans.use: to pay for her son's treatment

loans.name: Ezna's Group

texts.en:
Eznah, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group of 9 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is 38 years old and a married mother of 7 children. She is often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Eznah has been a farmer for 17 years, she is new to One Acre Fund.  She decided to join this year because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Eznah wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Eznah hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, as, even though Eznah decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en:
Savoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savoeun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is not reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 8 years.  In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maribel Cristina

texts.es:
Maribel es una Mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 8 años, la actividad de Maribel es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora buena Madre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza todos los días, ella tiene su puesto de venta de comida en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’; una comunidad campesina que agrupa a restaurantes que se especializan en comida típica y donde se elabora la ‘chicha’ (bebida fermentada de maíz).
Maribel es de tez morena, cabello negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español. y su hija que estudia en la escuela, toda la familia vive en una casa propia en obra gruesa que cuenta con luz y agua de pozo. Durante casi toda su vida viene construyendo su casa, poco a poco y ladrillo a ladrillo; logró construir dos habitaciones una cocina, un baño y lavandería, el siguiente paso es la instalación de agua potable, actualmente recoge agua de un pozo manualmente con un balde atado a una cuerda. Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa, y desea realizar una inversión en la instalación de agua potable para su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia una vida segura. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución.
Es por esos motivos que Maribel solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su casa y brindarle un hogar seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 35 year-old married woman who has an 8 year-old daughter. She makes a living selling food. 

She is an entrepreneur as well as a good mother who is responsible and hard-working. She works every day at her vending stall in the town of 'Sacaba', a farming community where there are several restaurants that serve traditional food and where 'chicha', a fermented corn drink, is made.

Maribel has dark skin, short black hair and is of medium stature. Her mother tongue is Quechua but she also speaks Spanish. Her daughter goes to school. The whole family lives in their own house which is undergoing structural works and they have electricity and well water. She has been building this house for almost her whole life, brick by brick. So far she has managed to build two bedrooms, a kitchen, bathroom and a laundry room. The next step is to install drinking water. At the moment she gets her water using a bucket tied to a rope. She dreams that her house can be finished and wants to invest in installing drinking water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so that her family have a safe life. This is her first loan cycle with the institution.

These are the reasons why Maribel is asking for a loan to install drinking water in her house and provide her family with a safe home.

loans.use: to install drinking water in her house.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia  sigue con su negocio de venta de anticuchos, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo los anticuchos a sus clientes que le solicitan cada dia,la socia también continua con su negocio de venta de frutas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, carbón, papas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Los Angeles" communal bank in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

The borrower is continuing with her business selling kebabs; she is very grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments. The member continues to sell kebabs and fruit to customers, allowing her to help her family to get ahead.

This borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy oil, coal, potatoes and more.

loans.use: to buy oil, coal, potatoes and more.

loans.name: Quintero Montero

texts.es:
El señor Darwin un hombre luchador de 32 años es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de los papas, el nació y creció en el campo, gracias a la ayuda de los padres pudo estudiar y salir adelante, actualmente es empleado en una empresa del sector, solicita este crédito para invertir en el inicio de un negocio, una granja de pollos, tiene mucho conocimiento sobre el mismo, aprendió mientras estudiaba, también junto con sus padres, unos años atrás ya tenía pollos pero tuvo que venderlos por un accidente que sufrió en uno de sus brazos y para recuperarse tenía que realizarse una operación muy costosa en esta invirtió todo su capital, es por eso que está pidiendo el apoyo de fundación alternativa y de kiva para poder volver a empezar con sus negocio
El vive y trabaja en un pequeño recinto llamado Simón Bolívar que está ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha cerca del Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado en el Kilómetro 127, el clima de este recinto es cálido húmedo, su gente es amable y trabajadora, cada año festejan las fiesta de San Pedro, también les gusta realizar encuentro deportivos para unir más sus lasas de amistad entre vecinos del sector, a este lugar llegan muchos turistas nacionales y extrajeras a disfrutar de la maravillosa flora y fauna silvestre, el señor Darwin agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Darwin is a plucky 32-year-old man. He is single and has no children. He lives at his parents' house. Darwin was born and raised in the countryside. Thanks to his parents, he was able to go to school and get ahead. He is currently employed at a local business but is applying for this loan in order to start a chicken farm business. Darwin knows a lot about this trade, having learned it while he was studying. In addition, he and his parents had chickens a few years ago but they were forced to sell them after Darwin suffered an injury to his arms and needed to pay for a very expensive operation. Darwin is now applying for support from Fundación Alternativa and Kiva in order to re-start his business.

Darwin lives and works in a small area known as Simón Bolívar, located in the northwest of Pichincha province and near the Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton (KM 127). The climate here is hot and humid, while the people are warm and hard-working. Every year the local area celebrates Saint Peter's Day. The people here like to meet to watch sports, strengthening the friendships between neighbours. Many domestic and international tourist come to the area to enjoy the wonderful flora, and the wild fauna. Darwin thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support provided.

loans.use: to start a chicken farm business and to be able to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanthou makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a cook to support her family. 

In their village there is not reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of them to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia pertenece al banco comunal JUNTOS PODEMOS, la socia tiene 46 años de edad es soltera y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesania,la socia elabora botas típicas  para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the "Juntos Podemos" communal bank. Sonia is 46 years old, single and has three children. She looks after her home and also has a business making traditional boots for customers. Sonia has had the business for some time and it is going well thanks to her determination. Sonia is applying for a loan in order to continue working and keep on supporting her family.

Sonia is applying for this loan in order to buy leathers and other materials.

Sonia is very grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy leathers and other materials.

loans.name: Cynthia Laura

texts.es:
La señora  Cynthia es una mujer de 19  años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un bebe de 5 meses de edad,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, ella es emprendedora, buena madre, luchadora, fuerte, constante independiente. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de Villa Adela  de la ciudad de El Alto, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio, con una temperatura que varía de los 0-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Cynthia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el español Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva con esta actividad.
Por este motivo solicita el préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos para surtir su tienda, porque estas fechas de fin de año tienen mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Señora Cynthia is a 19 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has a 5 month old baby. She makes a living selling basic goods and groceries in her shop. She is enterprising, strong, reliable, independent, determined, and a good mother. 

She works in an area called Villa Adela in El Alto city. It is an area characterised by a growth in businesses and the temperature varies between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade throughout the year. Cynthia is of a medium height, with dark skin and long dark hair and a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Spanish. 

This is her first loan with Emprender and she has run her business for a year now. For this reason she is asking for the loan to buy a variety of products in order to restock her shop, because there is always an increase in demand at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products and restock her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase traditional cloths

loans.name: Taw Ku Shae Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Myanmar’s Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. The Community Based Organization (CBO) consists of five committee members overseeing 16 village customers. This new loan will help the Taw Ku Shae Village group members buy more ducks and high quality feed (one packet costs $12, feeding 100 ducks for a week). More ducks will mean an increase in income from more duck eggs. The villagers mostly specialize in farming crops and need the help of buffalos to work their farms as they barely own machines. As for livestock, they usually raise pigs,ducks and goats. 
Pictured above are the CBO loan recipients of this village; their names are U Kyaw, U Kyaw Tin, U Zae, U Soe and Daw Sadar. U Soe (second from left) is 45 years old. He farms crops and also raises ducks. U Soe is married, with three sons who are at school. He uses his income from 125 ducks to support his family, including his mother, who is ill and requires expensive treatment. Like his fellow members, U Soe will use the loan to buy more food for his ducks to enable more egg hatching, and command a higher price for his ducks.

loans.use: to buy ducks as well as high-quality feed.

loans.name: Reyna Floridalma

texts.es:
Reyna es casada tiene dos hijos vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Solola. 

Reyna es una mujer muy comprometedora con su familia, ella siempre le gusta apoyar a su esposo en lo que pueda, ella a pesar de su responsabilidad como ama de casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica ella venda en su comunidad, ya que en el lugar donde vive ella es muy bonita y es muy visitado por turistas nacionales e internacionales. Reyna es una mujer que le gusta experimentar todo tipo de trabajo ella también labora pulseras, todo este trabajo ella lo hace con  mucha paciencia y dedicación. 

Ella cada día piensa en sus hijos, como todo padre o madre de familia, lo que busca es la prosperidad, ella es un pilar para su esposo, pues viendo las necesidades que hay dentro de su familia,  Reyna propone a su esposo  para buscar un préstamo que lo utilizaría para la remodelación de su vivienda, ya que a su casa le hace falta varios trabajos. 

El sueño de Reyna es conseguir el préstamo y empezar ya con la remodelación, para que tengan un lugar donde descansar tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in the community of Solola. 

Reyna is a woman very committed to her family. She always likes to support her husband in what she can. Despite her responsibilities as a housewife, she works buying and selling typical clothing. She sells it in her community, because the place where she lives is very pretty and is visited by many domestic and international tourists. Reyna is a woman who likes to experience all sorts of work. She also makes bracelets, and does all of this work with a lot of patience and dedication. 

Every day, she thinks of her children, like all parents, and what she wants is prosperity. She is a pillar for her husband, and seeing the needs that there are in the family, Reyna suggests to her husband asking for a loan that will be used to remodel her house, since it is a house that needs some work. 

Reyna's dream is to get the loan and begin with the renovations soon, so that she and her family  have a place to rest.

loans.use: to renovate the house.

loans.name: Ingrid Lisbeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuestra Señora De la Luz se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ingrid, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 9 meses. El marido es asesor comercial. 
Doña Ingrid es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos de Avon, Belcorp y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella trabaja dos a tres horas al día ya sea en la mañana o en horas de la noche, la mayoría de sus productos son para entregar ya que cuenta con mucha clientela, ella deja a cerdito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva casi 3  años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Nuestra Señora De la Luz communal bank group meets every two weeks in the city of Manta. This is a city known for its lovely beaches, which are visited by many people all year round, and for being a city with an unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Ingrid lives in this place. She is 19 years old and in a common-law-marriage in which she has a 9-month-old child. Her husband is a business consultant.

Ingris is a housewife who, to get her own resources, and with this, help her husband with the expenses, works in sales. She sells products from Avon, Belcorp and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She sells door to door, and works two to three hours each day, either in the morning or at night. The majority of her products are by order since she has many customers. She leaves the item on credit and collects each week. She has worked in this business for almost 3 years, which allows her to earn her own way.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. This is her second loan cycle in the communal bank group and she likes it for the help that the loans offer. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima is a hardworking woman who was born in 1983. She lives in the city of Khujand and is single. She is from a poor family and her parents are pensioners with disabilities. Fotima alone supports her family as a retailer, buying and selling cookies. She buys from a city supplier and sells to rural customers. What she earns from her business provides her family with less than the average standard of living. She needs some financial support to buy more cookies so she can increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy more cookies to sell

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola, una mujer de 32 años de edad que se encuentra muy motivada y emocionada ante la oportunidad que se le presenta en la vida y es que gracias a la Corporación Interactuar puede solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de alimentos como arepas rellenas con todo tipo de ingredientes, un sueño que le ha sido errado pues al ser su primera experiencia crediticia no le desembolsaban el préstamo. 

Con el crédito solicitado comprara surtido de ingredientes, recipientes, sillas y mesas. 

Este crédito será de suma importancia para Paola pues representa el principio de una vida como independiente y una oportunidad de progresar como empresaria.
texts.en:
Paola is 32 years old, highly motivated, and very excited at the opportunity she's found. Thanks to the  Corporación Interactuar, Paola can apply for a loan in order to start her own business selling food such as tortillas filled with a tremendous variety of ingredients. Starting this business is a goal that Paola has been unable to reach since the first time she applied for a loan and the lender didn't pay out the funds.  

Paola will use the funds from this loan to purchase ingredients, containers, chairs, and tables. The loan is critically important for Paola as it represents the start of an independent life and the opportunity to succeed as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, containers, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Ihboldzhon

texts.ru: Ихболджон женщина 40 лет , замужем , мать четверых детей . Получив педагогическую профессию,она не смогла работать по своей специальности,так как учительской зарплаты не хватало даже на ежедневные расходы.Поэтому она решила заняться собственным делом  животноводством.На участке земли,оставшемся от ее дедушки,Ихболджон начала разводить скот . Сейчас у нее большое стадо ,коровы ,бараны и овцы.Каждое утро ее дочь помогает ей доить коров и относит молоко на рынок для продажи.
