Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Jose!
texts.en: Jose is a person who has had to overcome many obstacles in life. Nevertheless, he has always had the strength to overcome them and move forward, together with his children. Approximately 19 years ago, he started desperately looking for a source of income for his household. This is how he started raising and selling chickens, a business that has generated earnings to allow him to support his household expenses. Jose is looking for a loan to allow him to buy chicken food, fix his chickens' corral and buy food for his chickens. He knows that with the help of Interactuar he can achieve this. Jose hopes that the loan will allow him to move forward with his business. He also hopes to grow his business and generate more income so he can offer his children a better quality of life and more opportunities to progress. With a loan that you make today you can improve Jose's life and business!

loans.use: to buy chicken food, fix his chickens' corral, and to buy food for his chickens.

loans.name: Benkola 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupes Benkola 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  M’pessoba, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et laitues  avec Djeneba, assise au bout vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0, 25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkola 2 group are married women who are, on average, 36 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in M'Pessoba, one of the villages in Koutiala, in the third administrative region of Mali. For the first time, they are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yirwaso in order to better carry out their market gardening.

Djeneba, who is seated at the end on the left of the photo, grows shallots and lettuce. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds, inputs, and materials to farm a quarter hectare of land. After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed group of customers.

Djeneba hopes to earn an average profit of 145,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and to cover her everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs, and materials

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 5 años de edad que son su mayor alegría y los apoya con sus estudios. Él se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de jugos, gaseosas y golosinas actividad que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que desea invertir en él para brindarles una mayor variedad de productos a su clientela, además desea brindarles una mayor comodidad para lo que comprará mesas y sillas, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, mesas, sillas, etc.
texts.en: Salvador, 30 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner and their three children, ages 13, 11, and 5 who are his greatest joy and he supports them with their education. He earns his living with a business selling juice, soft drinks, and sweets, work he has done for a long time, so he has many customers who ask for his products. So, he wants to invest in it to offer his customers a greater variety of products, in addition he wants to offer them more comfort so he will purchase tables and chairs. For this, he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in sweets, soft drinks, juices, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.use: to invest in sweets, soft drinks, juices, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is his story:

“My profession must satisfy my three demands: firstly, it must be interesting for me; secondly, it must correspond to the opportunities I have; thirdly, it must allow me to support my family in future. All these aspects meet International and Business Law Program in AUCA. The fact that my family can’t afford my tuition fee there, forces me to apply for a Kiva loan. The Kiva loan will be of great help for my family in paying my university tuition fee.

I live with my parents in one-bedroom apartment. My father is a public servant and, since 2005 my mother is a house-wife. The public servants in my country have a small salary, what is even not enough for the daily necessities, without saying about the tuition fee of the prestigious university. We don’t have a car or other property, what we could use or rent, so we don’t have other sources of income and we used to save money all the time. Hopefully, the financial situation of my family will change to the better after my graduation and we will be able to buy a bigger house.

I think that AUCA is the best university for me. The most important thing of it is that AUCA’s students in IBL Program can practice at the Legal Clinic of AUCA, which provides needy citizens with free legal counsel. Students are able to work on real civil and criminal cases there. It means that we consolidate theory with practice, which is very useful for every beginner-expert in this field.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Edwin Patricio

texts.es:
Edwin  es un hombre de 23 años de edad , actualmente se encuentra  casado con Enma, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chico para poder sustentar sus necesidades y poder terminar la secundaria.
 Ahora Edwin  vive junto a su familia  en la parroquia Juan Montalvo  del Cantón Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador en un barrio llamado Pusuchisi. Este sector  está ubicado en el noroccidente de la provincia, es una zona rural su clima es muy frio, aquí la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Edwin  heredó de sus padres la habilidad para la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, cerdos , terneros, conejos etc. A esta actividad se dedica desde hace tres años atrás y dedica de  8 a 10 horas cada día paralelamente con las actividades del hogar .  Con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años , se siente preparado para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual que harán que su producción aumente para que de esta manera  pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su familia, 
Edwin  y su familia  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 23 year old man. He is married to Emma. He was able to finish primary school thanks to the efforts of his parents. Later the lack of financial resources led him to work at an early age in order to support their needs and to finish secondary.

Now Edwin lives with his family in the parish of Juan Montalvo, in the canton of Latacunga, located in the province of Cotopaxi, Ecuador, in a neighborhood called Pusuchisi. This sector is located in the northwestern part of the province. It is a rural area with a cold climate. Most of the people here work in agriculture and raising small animals because of its climate and geographical location which produces results on the crops of products from the Sierra Region. Its people do these activities from day-to-day. Although it is a place located far from the city, there are families devoted to all types of activities to meet their needs and those of their community.

Edwin inherited from his parents the ability to raise and sell small animals such as chickens, pigs, calves, rabbits, etc. He has been doing this activity for three years and works from 8 to 10 hours each day in parallel with his household duties.

He feels ready to put the experience that he acquired through the years to use by increasing production so that he can improve his way of life and that of his family.

Edwin and his family are grateful to Fundación Alternative and Kiva for making it possible for growth in his work and personal life.

loans.use: to expand by buying more small animals so he can improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, chicken, yucca, tomatoes, spices, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Hilola

texts.en:
Hilola is a responsive woman. She was born in 1988. She lives in rural area. She is married. She has two children. She has her own business. She works in land and agriculture. She keeps livestock and plants seeds. It is hard for her to do both. But she is strong. 

She spends all she earns on her everyday life. Hilola wants to make her standard of living better. 

She is planning to buy heating materials for winter. She is asking for support in order to have good conditions for living this winter.

loans.use: To buy heating materials for winter

loans.name: Benkola 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupes Benkola 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  M’pessoba, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote avec Mama, assise vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0, 25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkola 3 group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in M'Pessoba, one of the villages in Koutiala, in the third administrative region of Mali. For the first time, they are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their market gardening.

Mama, who is seated on the left in the photo, grows shallots. With her loan she plans to buy seeds, inputs, and materials to farm a quarter hectare of land. After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed group of customers.

Mama hopes to earn an average profit of 140,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs, and materials

loans.name: Cara

texts.en: Cara is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari (variety store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. This store has been Cara's source of income for several years. Cara is asking for a loan to buy more stocks such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments and snack foods, to sell. She also wants to buy piglets to raise. Cara believes that this loan will help her improve her business, thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Cara wants to expand her store and make it sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments and snack foods, to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a 48-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. Elma is engaged in the retail sales of rice. Elma has been in this business for more than 20 years now. She also earns an additional income through her hog raising business. Elma is asking to take a loan to buy more rice and piglets to raise.  With a loan, she will be able to improve her rice stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Elma hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice and piglets to raise

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina is 36 years. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. Vivina sells clothing, a business she has been in for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Vivina has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of 10,000 KES which she will use to purchase a new stock of clothes.

With the anticipated profits, Vivina will be able to restock her business further. Her hope and dream for the future is to be successful in business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of clothes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es una mujer con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de variedades y artículos para el hogar, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y sostener a sus hijos.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de artículos y elementos para el hogar para abastecer su negocio y tener un buen inventario para estas fechas.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darles a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan, además de poder progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una madre emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Betty is a woman with a lot of energy and a disposition to face the world and succeed.

She wants to start a business selling a variety of household items. With this business, she will earn income so she can maintain and support her children.

She is requesting this loan to stock up on items for the home to stock up her business and to have a better inventory for the coming days.

With this loan, she can fulfill her dream of being independent and giving her children everything they need. Also, she will be able to progress thanks to Kiva and Corporación Interactuar.

Support this enterprising Colombian woman’s project!

loans.use: to stock up on items for the home to stock up her business.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan is a 53-year-old married rice farmer with three children. Her husband is also a rice farmer, and they have been cultivating rice for over 14 years. One of Nan's children is a garment worker and two are construction workers. They all live in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia and, together, they earn approximately $18 a day. 

To earn more income for the family, Nan has decided to secure a loan to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell. This loan will enable her to make more income to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, Nan wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Kirangara Savings And Credit. Group

texts.en: Joseph, aged 33, is a member of Kirangara Savings and Credit, where members guarantee each other. He lives with 4 children in Fort Portal, Uganda. Joseph rides a motorcycle and also does farming, growing crops such as cabbages and tomatoes. His main challenges are fuel price fluctuations and unpredictable weather changes, like other farmers. However, Joseph hopes to start a timber business. He needs a loan to reinvest in farming by spraying, weeding and harvesting.

loans.use: to reinvest in farming by spraying, weeding and harvesting.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She and her family live in Albuera, Leyte. Three years ago, Agnes started investing in a poultry business. It is doing well, and she would like to expand her business for sustainability. Agnes is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more chicks to raise and sell after 45 days. Agnes would like to ensure that her business will continue to flourish, giving her a better return of investment to save for the future and to buy healthy meals for her family.

loans.use: to buy more chicks

loans.name: Berta

texts.es: Berta de 50 años de edad es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza cada día para sostener a su familia, por lo que cuenta con venta de productos de la canasta básica, en su vivienda y aprovechando la clientela vende productos de belleza por catálogo, pero además esta laboriosa mujer vende ropa para dama de forma ambulante. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 27 años de edad a la que ha sacado adelante sola después de la pérdida de su esposo. En esta época navideña Berta desea mejorar sus ventas y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa para dama, productos de la canasta básica y productos de belleza para tener mejores ingresos económicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Berta, 50 years old, is an admirable woman who works hard each day to sustain her family. So she sells pantry staples in her house and, taking advantage of her customer base, sells beauty products by catalog. But, in addition, this hard-working woman sells ladies' clothing as a street vendor.  She lives in her own house with her 27-year-old daughter, whom she has gotten ahead alone after losing her husband. 

In this Christmas season, Berta wants to improve her sales and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in ladies' clothing, pantry staples, and beauty products to have more income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in ladies' clothing, pantry staples, and beauty products.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is from Albuera, Leyte. She is married with three adult children. Eight years ago, she started raising hogs and selling home-cooked meals such as fried fish, sauteed vegetables, noodles and snacks like pancakes, rice cakes and maja blanca to earn a living. Her business has been instrumental in providing for her family's needs such as food and household bills. Cristita is requesting a loan to buy hog fattening and ingredients for food vending such as flour, sugar, evaporated milk, baking powder, baking cups, vanilla food flavor and cheese. With the availability of these items, she will be able to focus on managing her business well for it to be more profitable. In the future, she hope to expand her food vending business to be more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy hog fattening and ingredients for food vending such as flour, sugar, evaporated milk, baking powder, baking cups, vanilla food flavor and cheese

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 41 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos. Su familia es unida. Vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú, la comunidad se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de combustible, brinda servicio de transporte en mototaxi y brinda también servicio de limpieza en casa de familias de este distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de combustible para abastecer pedidos de sus clientes, con ello tendrá una mejor atención a los clientes que demanden su servicio y así generará mayores ingresos, logrando con esto una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria, 41 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her own house with her 2 children. Her family is close-knit. She lives in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque province, on the northern coast of Perú; the community works in trade, agriculture, and animal husbandry. 

Gloria works selling gas, she offers a motorcycle transportation service, and also offers cleaning services in the homes of families in this district. The loan will be used to purchase gas to fill her customers' orders. With that, she will provide better service for the customers who want her service and also will generate more income, with this managing an improvement to her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase gas to fill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en: Yegana is a 47-year-old widow who has a daughter. She lives with her parents and daughter in Agsu region. She has experienced a lot of difficulties. Yegana has land where she grows different kinds of vegetables and crops. She earns additional income from animal husbandry. Yegana works hard every day from early in the morning because she has a large family and needs money for providing her family with all the necessary things. Yegana is going to sow her crops, but she has no money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 500 AZN to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
La socia Balbina pertenece al banco comunal TERESA DE JESUS, la socia tiene 51 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose vender comida (refrigerios),  la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma apoyar a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de aceite, carnes, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Balbina, 51, is a member of Teresa de Jesús Communal Bank.  She's married and has three children.

She alternates her daily activities with selling food (snacks).  She has had this business for some time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to keep on working so she can support her family.

Balbina requested the loan to buy oil, meat, rice, and other ingredients.  She's grateful and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, rice, and other ingredients

loans.name: 10 De Abril Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento 10 DE ABRIL compuesta por ocho integrantes de las cuales siete son mujeres y un varón, ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de celulares,  venta de jugo naturales, venta de cosméticos, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios.

Betsi es una joven mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de teléfonos celulares.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, trabajadora, constante y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en un mercado de localidad deL Torno caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población proveniente de tribus nómadas del lugar como ‘Los Ayoreos’ dedicados en la mayoría  a la agricultura que hicieron de este sitio su hogar y generaron un comercio constante en todas las áreas .
Betsi (en la foto es la señora que blusa blanca y puntos negros parada en el lado derecho la segunda persona)es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua nativa es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte como chofer asalariado y sus dos hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de teléfonos celulares Su labor la realiza de lunes a sábado porque el domingo se dedica a sus hijos, Ya lleva tres años de experiencia en el negocio y este es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer productos al por mayor. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando una inversión en la compra de mayor cantidad de teléfonos, debido a las fiestas de fin de año sus ventas mejoran.
Es por esos motivos que Betsi solicita un préstamo para la compra de teléfonos celulares por mayor para aprovechar las ventas en las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
The lending group "10 de Abril" is made up of eight members, including seven women and one man. The women make a living in different types of activities, including upholstering cars, selling juices/smoothies, selling cellphones, selling natural juices, selling cosmetics, selling drinks, and selling clothing.

Betsi is a young, 33-year-old woman. She lives together with her partner and their two children (ages 16 and 8). Her business is selling cellphones.

She is a good mother and is an independent, hardworking, and very responsible woman. She carries out her work at the local market in Torno, a community that is characterized by a constant rise in population due to the nomadic tribes in the area, like the Ayoreos. These people generally work in agriculture and made their home in Torno and established a steady trade network throughout the region.

Betsi (standing in the photo in a white and black printed blouse, second from the right) has a darker complexion and is of average height. She has long black hair and her native tongue is Spanish, although she also knows the indigenous Guarani language because of her heritage. Her husband makes a living in the transportation industry as a salaried driver. They have two children; the oldest is studying in school. They all live together in a house that they own with water, electricity and sewage services.

Betsi works selling cellphones. She does this Monday to Saturday, being sure to dedicate Sundays to her children. She has been doing this work for three years and this is her first loan through this lending institution. Her dream is to have her own store where she can offer her products wholesale. Betsi hopes to grow her business by investing the loan in the purchase of cellphones wholesale; her sales should increase during the end-of-year celebrations.

For these reasons, Betsi is requesting a loan. She will buy cellphones wholesale in order to take advantage of the end-of-year season.

loans.use: to buy cellphones wholesale.

loans.name: Jay Liza

texts.en:
Jay Liza is 37 years old. She is from the town of Carles, Iloilo. In 2007, she started raising hogs to earn a living. She also operates a sari-sari store for additional income. She sell items such as noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, soy sauce, chips, shampoo, toothpaste, detergent and bath soap. 

Jay Liza is asking a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more supply for her store such as rice, canned goods, chips, seasoning, toiletries, eggs, noodles and needs for the hogs like feed and more piglets. Her income will allow her to save and provide for her parents. 

In the future, Jay Liza would like to expand her business, make her store bigger and add more pigs to raise to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed, piglets, canned goods, chips, seasoning, toiletries, eggs, noodles.

loans.name: Blanca Mael

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuestra Señora De la Luz se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual esta esperando su primer bebé, tiene 4  meses de embarazo. El marido es taxista.
Doña Blanc en sociedad con la mamá se dedican al comercio, ellas venden ropa, zapatos, productos de Avon, Belcorp y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  salen en momentos desocupados y no tiene horario fijo, también venden en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ellas dejan a crédito  y cobran por semanas o quincenas,  lleva  más de 2 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos,  perfumes,  cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Ella lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así se financia para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
The Nuestra Señora de la Luz group meets twice a month in the city of Manta. It is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in all seasons of the year and for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Blanca lives here in this place. She is 19 years old and has a life-companion and is expecting her first baby. She is 4 months pregnant. Her spouse is a taxi driver.

Blanca works in partnership with her mother in commerce. They sell clothing, shoes, and Avon, Belcorp, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetic, perfumes, and accessories for women). They go from door-to-door when they have time available. They do not have a fixed schedule. They also sell from home to well-known customers on weekly or fortnightly credit. This activity allows her to earn something on her own.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other items to sell. This is her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the funding allows her to get ahead. She dreams of having her baby.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc., for her business

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en: Nicanor is a 66-year-old married man from Leyte, Philippines. He has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of his income. Nicanor is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise. With this, Nicanor will be able to improve his hog raising business thus allowing him to augment his profit and income. In the future, Nicanor hopes to make his business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Rosa Angela

texts.es:
Rosa Angela tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Lagunas, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Esta comunidad está habitada por gente sencilla y amable, dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, pavos, cuyes, pollos y otros, desde hace 05 años, cuenta con clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Adicionalmente se dedica a prestar servicios como peón agrícola en su distrito. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, para implementar una tienda en su domicilio, con esto Rosa Angela espera generar ingresos adicionales para poder incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Angela, age 52, is a single mother.  She lives with her children in her own house in the Lagunas district in the Lambayeque province on the northern coast of Peru.  The inhabitants of this community are down to earth and friendly people.  They primarily work in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.

She has been raising and selling small animals like ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, and chickens, and others for five years.  She has fixed customers in the area, and they provide her with very good personal and work references.  She also provides her services as a farm worker in her district.

This loan will be used to buy products like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and noodles, among other in order to set up a store at her house.  With this, Angela hopes to generate additional income in order to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and noodles, among other in order to set up a store at her house.

loans.name: Jose Eriberto

texts.es:
Jose Eriberto tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y menores hijos en el Caserío El Frayle, provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, en la zona norte de Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura (café y maíz), crianza de animales menores como pavos, patos, gallinas y cuyes y al comercio de los mismos.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cafeto desde hace 07 años, tiene cultivado una parcela cercana a su vivienda, su esposa le apoya en las actividades relacionadas al cultivo. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, los cuales comercializa en el distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abonos órganicos al por mayor, para que de esta manera pueda darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor producción y calidad de cultivo para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que aumentará su nivel de ventas y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Eriberto is 39 years old, lives with his spouse and young children in the village of El Frayle, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern part of Perú. Its population works in agriculture (coffee and corn), raising small animals such as turkeys, hens, and guinea pigs, and in selling these products. 

He works in agriculture, and has cultivated coffee for 7 years. He has planted a plot near his home and his wife helps him in his work related to the crop. He also works raising small animals, which he sells in the district. He asks for a loan to purchase organic manure in bulk, to be able in this way to give upkeep to his coffee crop, which will allow him to have a better production and quality of his crop to offer his customers, which will increase his level of sales and, in the end, his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure in bulk to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Auner

texts.es:
Auner tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa . El domicilio del cliente se ubica en el Caserío Queromarca, distrito de Pucará, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias del señor Auner.

La actividad que realiza Auner es la de sembrar café variedad Catimor. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en mantenimiento del terreno cultivable, realizando compra de abono, pesticidas, entre otros insumos que le permitan mejorar su cultivo. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Auner is 48 years old and lives in his own house, made of rustic materials, with his wife. The client's home is located in the village of Queromarca, Pucará district, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. The community where the client lives is a small rural zone which primary works in agriculture; the inhabitants know each other and give good references for Auner. 

The work that Auner does is planting Catimor coffee. He will use the loan to invest in maintaining his cropland, purchasing manure and pesticides, among other supplies that will allow him to improve his crop. This investment will let him get earnings to improve his economic situation and, in the end, improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain his cropland, purchasing manure and pesticides, among other supplies.

loans.name: Ramelo

texts.en: Ramelo is a 47-year-old married man and a father of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. He has been engaged in the vegetable farming business for more than three years now.  He earns an additional income through his poultry business. Ramelo is asking to take a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm and animal feed for the poultry business. Ramelo believes that this loan will enable him to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting his income and profit. Ramelo dreams of improving his livelihood and saving money for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm and animal feed for the poultry business

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo plátano; alimentos que vende en el municipio de Norcasia.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de café.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Hernando is a humble and hard-working farmer with the drive and tenacity that sets him apart from other men and women who work in the fields.  He is a man with an enterprising mind.  When he was very little he learned all about farming like growing crops and raising animals.  He now has his own banana crop, food that he sells in the Norcasia municipality.

His plan is to increase his crops and to improve those that he currently has.  That is why he turns to the help of a loan with Interactuar.  He will use the loan to buy farming supplies like fertilizers, compost, and coffee seeds.

The loan will give him the chance to progress as a businessman and as a person.  He will also increase his income and continue contributing to the support of his household.  The only thing that he wants is to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like fertilizers, compost, and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Maria Margarita tiene 63 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros desde hace más de 15 años, cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería como pantalones, blusas, polos y vestidos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, de esta manera Maria Margarita espera hacer crecer más su negocio y poder satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ventas, mejorar sus ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita, age 63, is a single mother.  She lives with her daughter in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce as their main business activities.

She has been selling women’s and men’s clothes for over 15 years.  She has fixed customers, and they provide her with very good personal and work references.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, polo style shirts, and dresses in order to increase the stock in her business.  This way, Maria Margarita hopes to make her business grow more and to be able to satisfy her customers’ tastes and preferences.  This will allow her to increase her level of sales, improve her earnings, and, therefore, improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, polo style shirts, and dresses in order to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Harold David

texts.es:
Harold a sus 27 años de edad, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo y por necesidad económica se motiva a independizarse y conseguir ingresos por su cuenta, por eso desea iniciar un negocio de comidas rápidas que estará ubicado en una esquina muy transitada del barrio donde reside en municipio de Planeta Rica.
El desea ofrecer en su negocio arepas de queso, patacones de plátano, chorizos con arepa, butifarras, arepas de chócolo, gaseosas entre otros, con esto espera conseguir los recursos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. 

Harold es un hombre trabajador, pujante, emprendedor, solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (sillas, carpa) e insumos para elaborar los alimentos (carnes frías, aceite, arepas, plátanos, gaseosas) para tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de todos sus clientes, de esta forma podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.

Gracias al apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar y a los prestamistas de Kiva podrá montar este negocio y conseguirá ser independiente.
texts.en:
Harold, 27, became motivated to make himself independent and earn income himself due to a lack of employment opportunities and the need to earn income. This desire moved him to start his own business in fast food, which is located on a high-traffic corner in the neighborhood where he lives in the town of Planeta Rica.

He wants to offer cheese corn cakes, fried bananas, sausage with corn cakes, Catalan sausage, sweet corn cakes, soft drinks, and other products. With this work, he hopes to get the necessary resources to satisfy his basic needs.

Harold is a hard-working, thriving, and enterprising man. He is requesting a loan for support to invest in buying fixed assets (chairs, awnings) and supplies to make food (cold fries, cooking oil, corn cakes, bananas, and soft drinks) to have a variety of products available to satisfy his customers’ needs. This will allow him to have a better quality of life and well-being.

Thanks to the support of Corporación Interactuar and Kiva lenders, he will be able to set up this business and continue to be independent.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets such as chairs, awnings, and supplies to make food such as cold meat, cooking oil, corn cakes, bananas, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn works hard to support her family. Rodelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rodelyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and earns additional income from rice retailing.

In the future, Rodelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 60 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling business of personal products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 12 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a woman who owns a house that has no piped water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Joyce has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is a 54-year-old widow and a mother of three grown up children from Leyte, Philippines. Milagros is engaged in the hog raising business. This has been her source of income for more than 4 years now. Milagros is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise. This loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income. In the future, Milagros hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Harry Anthony

texts.en: Harry Anthony is a 27-year-old married man and a father of two children from Leyte, Philippines. He runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. Harry Anthony is requesting for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, snack foods, condiments and others. This loan will enable him to improve his inventories thus attracting more buyers into his store. In the future, Harry Anthony hopes to make his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, snack foods, condiments and others

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer  de 56 años de edad, casada, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de frazadas y edredones.
Ella es generosa, amable, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘villa Avaroa’ un área caracterizada por el comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados.
Delia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio, sus hijos son casados e independientes, viven en una casa propia de la familia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de cama, como; frazadas, edredones y cojines. Labor que realiza de forma ambulante en distintas ferias y comercios de la zona. “la venta de frazadas y edredones es continua, debido al frio del lugar, esto hace de mi negocio un éxito…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta fijo para dejar de ambular. Ella desea realizar una inversión mediante la compra de frazadas y edredones de temporada por mayor, para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
Es por esos motivos que Delia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de cama por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Delia is a 56-year-old woman, married, with independent children, and her business is selling blankets and bedspreads. 

She is generous, friendly, independent, dependable, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is in the "Villa Avaroa" zone, an area characterized by commerce and manufacturing in all areas, with a cold and dry climate and a temperature that varies during the day between 5-15 degrees centigrade. 

Delia has tanned skin, long black hair she keeps tied up, dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her husband, who works in commerce, her children are married and independent, and they live in a brick house owned by the family, with a corrugated iron roof, that has drinking water, electricity, domestic gas, and sewer services.

Her business is selling bedding such as blankets, bedspreads and cushions. She does this work as a street vendor in various fairs and businesses in the zone. "The sale of blankets and bedspreads is constant, due to the coldness of the area, this makes my business a success..." she says. Her dream is to have a permanent sales location to stop travelling. She wants to make an investment through the purchase of seasonal blankets and bedspreads in bulk, to meet the seasonal demand. 

For these reasons, Delia asks for a loan to purchase bedding in bulk to meet the seasonal demand.

loans.use: to purchase bedding to meet the seasonal demand.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como cerdos, patos, pollos, gallos, gallinas, etc; con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para mejoramiento de la infraestructura de sus corrales, donde cría sus animales y para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde. Beatriz piensa lograr mejores condiciones en sus animales, para así mejorar la productividad de su negocio y con ello poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo que repercutirá en su nivel de ventas y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 26, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in the Oyotún district of the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

She raises and sells animals such as pigs, ducks, chickens, roosters, hens, etc.  She has more than five years of experience in her business, which is located right at her home.

She's requesting a loan to improve the infrastructure of the corrals where she raises her animals and to buy balanced feed for fattening.

Beatriz plans to achieve better conditions in her animals so she can improve her business productivity and tend to the various needs and desires of her customers in the area.  This will affect her sales level and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the corrals where she raises her animals and to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals

loans.name: Ngirankugire Group

texts.en: Angelique is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 6 years old, two of them whom go to school. The group is called NGIRANKUGIRE, which means “SUPPORT EACH OTHER” in English. The members of this group sell different products and they have common goals to scale their business for a better future. Angelique sells vegetables and has been in this business for 4 years now. With the loan, she would like to buy more carrots and cabbages for sale. The profits from this business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more carrots and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Cesar Bornaceli

texts.es:
Cesar inicio la venta de cerveza y bebidas, hace meses atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a un amigo, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como hombre pujante y emprendedor busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por sus dos hijos y su esposa.

Debido al costo de vida tan alto, Cesar se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es por este motivo que necesita un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes. 

Solicita un crédito para la Cesar inicio la venta de cerveza y bebidas, hace meses atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a un amigo, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como hombre pujante y emprendedor busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por sus dos hijos y su esposa.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de bebidas y cervezas para aumentar su inventario.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en el propietario de una gran distribuidora con gran variedad de bebidas y aliemntos y sabe que está por buen camino de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Cesar started selling beer and drinks months ago.  He learned this business activity thanks to a friend.  He sought out this business activity as an alternative way of generating money.  As a tenacious and enterprising man, he desperately seeks sustenance for his household, which is comprised of his two children and his wife.

Because the cost of living is so high, Cesar sees the need to generate more income.  That is the reason that he needs financial support to help him improve the variety of products that he displays and sells to his customers daily.  He is requesting a loan to buy stock of drinks and beer to increase his inventory.

His main dream is to be able to become the proprietor of a distributorship with a great variety of drinks and food.  He knows that he is on a good path with Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy stock of drinks and beer to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Sulltane

texts.en:
Sulltane is a 59-year-old villager and a married mother of two who wants to buy a dairy cow that will cost her an amount of 168,000.Albanian lek; with the additional money, an amount of 32,000.Albanian lek left from the loan, she wants to pay for her retirement pension contribution for the year 2014. 
Sulltane has a vineyard from where she makes a Grappa alcohol drink called ‘raki’ locally. She then sells it to bars and restaurants in their neighborhood. Sulltane has a son who works in a neighboring country and who helps them financially. She also plants seasonal veggies for her family's use and then she sells the rest. Sulltane wants to establish a cow farm, since it has been proven that has been profitable.She will start with one dairy cow at first and then continue on adding some more cows until she establishes a cow farm.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and then keep adding some more cows until she establishes a cow farm

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es:
Ana, de 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, estudió hasta sexto grado, debido a que sus padres eran de muy bajos recursos económicos y se les hizo dificil seguirla mandando a la escuela.- Tiene una hija que estudia 9º grado y su compañero de vida, las abandonó cuando su hija estaba pequeña, ahora vive con sus padres y su hija.

Ana, trabaja en la agricultura desde que era muy pequeña, su padre fue quien le enseñó este trabajo, cuando salió de la escuela, se esforzó en aprenderlo, ya que pensó en que sería su fuente de ingreso en un futuro y asi fue.- Siembra maíz, su cultivo está a una distancia de medio kilómetro de su hogar, pero eso no es una dificultad cuando se trata de obtener buenos resultados, por lo tanto se tiene que ir muy temprano para el campo a trabajar, su hija y sus padres también le apoyan en la siembra de granos básicos.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una bolsa de semilla de maíz, cuatro sacos de abono, pesticidas y para pagar la mano de obra. 

El anhelo de Ana, es sacar adelante a su hija, para que tenga las oportunidades académicas que ella no tuvo, asi mismo que la cosecha le de buenos resultados, ya que con la ganancia espera hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and is a single mother. She studied only until the sixth grade, due to the fact that her parents had few economic resources and therefore found it difficult to continue sending her to school. She has a daughter that is currently studying in the ninth grade. Her life partner abandoned them when her daughter was very young. Now Ana and her daughter live with her parents.

Ana has been working in agriculture since she was very young. Her father began teaching her this work once she was no longer able to attend school, believing that it would be a means for her to earn an income in the future. She grows corn, and her crops are located about a half kilometer from her home. This distance is not a challenge for her; she is just trying to produce good results. She travels to her lands to work very early in the morning. Her daughter and parents also help her during the planting process.

The loan will be used to buy a sack of corn seed, four sacks of fertilizer, pesticides, and to additionally pay the workers who help her.

Ana aspires to move her daughter ahead and to support her so that she has the educational opportunities that she could never have as a child. She also hopes that her harvest yields good results and that she will be able to make improvements to her home with the profits she makes from her work.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn seed, four sacks of fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. 

Hace aproximadamente 11 años inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Francisco busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos y adecuar el corral de sus pollos. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Francisco tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Francisco!
texts.en:
Francisco is a person who has had to deal with many adversities in his life, however he has always had the strength to overcome them and get ahead along with his children.

Approximately 11 years, he desperately began the search for a source of income for his household. It was in this way that he began raising and selling chickens, a business that has been generating earnings with which he can pay the household expenses. 

Francisco looks for a loan to offer him the possibility of purchasing concentrated feed for the chickens and fixing up the chicken coop. He knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar he will be able to achieve it.  

Francisco has the hope that the loan will allow him to get ahead with his business. In addition, he hopes that his business grows and generates more income, with which he will be able to offer his children a better quality of life and more opportunities for progress. 

With a loan that you make today, you can improve Francisco's life and business!

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed for the chickens and fix up the chicken coop.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a strong woman who was born in 1984. She lives in a rural area from the northern part of Tajikistan. She is a widow and has three children. 

Shoira has an agriculture business in which she plants seeds and keeps cattle. She likes to do business in this sphere earning some income from this business. She has bad conditions of living, so she decided to renovate her house. 

Shoira is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing her house to make better her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 42 years old, married and lives in Amulung with her family. She is managing a variety store selling grocery items and vegetables to the people in her village. She sells good and affordable products. All her customers are happy with her services. 

She wants to increase her merchandise and expand her business that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, milk, sugar, breads and biscuits to sell. This will help increase sales capacity and income as well. 

She hopes to continue her business and achieve economic stability. She will also save additional revenue for family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, milk, sugar, breads and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 64-year-old woman from Leyte, Philippines. Teresita is engaged in the repair of wristwatches. This has been the source of her income for more than 25 years now. Teresita is also engaged in retail sales of rice. 

Teresita is asking to take a loan to buy spare parts like nuts and bolts, glass and straps. She also wants to improve her rice stock. This loan will help her improve her business, as well as her income. In the future, Teresita has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like nuts and bolts, glass and straps for wristwatch repair

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old. She is widowed and supports four people in her family.

Mary runs a retail business which she has done for more than 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. She deals with mobile phone accessories, as well as local money transfer services commonly referred to as "M-pesa."

Mary has requested her third loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 45,000, which she will use to add float for M-pesa. With the anticipated profits, Mary will be able to expand her business further. She successfully repaid her previous loans.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become an entrepreneur and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add float for M-pesa

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Marilou is a very hard-working woman. Aside from taking good care of her children, she also helps her husband in their fishing business. Fishing has provided them income for the past 10 years now. Marilou is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails, epoxy adhesives, and paints, and to buy additional stocks for the sari-sari like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, condiments and beverages. Marilou hopes to make her business successful and productive through the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails, epoxy adhesives, and paints, and to buy additional stocks for the sari-sari like canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Kyarwehuuta Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Paul is a 59-year-old hard-working married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He acquired his start-up capital from farming. He opened up a retail shop for general merchandise to help him look after his family and has been in business for over 10 years. 

Paul has a personal goal of building a permanent home for the family. Paul is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell for his retail shop. He is a member of the Kyarwehuuta group where every member guarantees each other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil for his retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is their source of income. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails and paints, epoxy and others. This will help them repair their fishing boat thus allowing them to go back to fishing. 

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to make their fishing business a success. She also wants to save some of their earnings for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails and paints, epoxy and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar and posho for resale.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.en: Ceferino is a 58-year-old married man from Leyte, Philippines. He makes a living through his hog raising business. Ceferino has raised pigs for more than 30 years now. Ceferino is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. He also wants to buy fertilizer for his rice field. With a loan, Ceferino will be able to improve his business, thus augmenting his income and profit. In the future, Ceferino dreams of making his business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a 60-year-old woman from the community of Albuera in Leyte. She is married with three children. The youngest is eighteen years old. Since three years ago, Elisa and her husband have been engaged in a tricycle business where her husband serves as the driver. She also supplements their income by selling trendy clothing known as RTW in her community. Elisa is asking a loan of 8000 PHP to further invest in her business. It will be used to buy spare parts for her tricycle such as tires and sprockets. Any income will be used for savings, their family daily consumption and reinvestment into the same business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle such as tires and sprockets

loans.name: Jak

texts.en: Jak managed to save some money, yet having his daughter in the university, he paid for her schooling fees. And now he is seeking your financial help again to invest in parts of electrical appliances.

loans.use: to buy used parts to build appliances and sell them afterwards

loans.name: Xheme

texts.en:
Xheme is seeking your financial help to pay for  her father-in-law Qazim’s surgical procedure that has been scheduled to take place in a private hospital as early as next month. Kindly note that public hospitals remain still in terrible condition; so many people die due to the lack of treatment or infections caught while in the hospital. Let alone that every Albanian citizen pays 10% towards the public health and this is mandatory for all, still, the service unfortunately, is not at the level that it should be. This makes many people seek treatment in private settings, which are not cheap at all.

Qazim has been a devoted Muslim all along and for the past 24 years he worked as a preacher. Xheme’s husband has a good job and receives good pay and the two of them have two children, 24 and 17.

loans.use: to pay for her father-in-law's surgical procedure

loans.name: Dorelis

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Dorelis, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.

Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y peces en el municipio de Turbo.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.

Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para el mantenimiento del estanque y el corral donde alberga sus animales.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y con la Corporación Interactuar que hacen posible que su negocio crezca y mejore.
texts.en:
Hard-working and visionary are two words that describe Dorelis perfectly, a hard-working family woman, who does everything in her reach to offer a better quality of life to her children and husband. 

She works raising and selling pigs and fish and the municipality of Turbo. This is a very common activity in this region and a large part of its inhabitants do it. 

She has a lot of knowledge in this area and thinks she needs a small boost to increase her sales and increase her business, and for this reason she asks for economic support to invest it in the purchase of materials to maintain the pond and the corral where she keeps her animals.

With this loan, she will be able to continue with her work, which is the only source of income for the family.

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders and to Corporación Interactuar that make it possible for her business to grow and improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain the pond and the corral where she keeps her animals.

loans.name: Bruno De Jesus

texts.es:
Bruno, con 60 años de edad, es un hombre casado y padre de tres hijos. 
Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de plátano, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 

El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio del plátano en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Bruno solicita su crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad.

Bruno sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual.
texts.en:
Bruno, 60, is a married man with three children.

He was born and raised in the country, where he learned agricultural skills from his father. Thanks to him, today he’s able to grow bananas. He sells the crops and is able to get the resources he needs to provide food at home.

This borrower is a thriving and fighting man who is dedicated to his family. This is what motivates him to work long days to try to move ahead. Day after day, he fights to overcome obstacles he’s confronted with. He has gone through difficult economic situations due to the low price of bananas on the market, which affects the price of his product.

Bruno is requesting this loan from Corporación Interactuar to invest in buying agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and pesticides to keep up with his business and prepare his crops so he will harvest a good-quality product.

Bruno dreams of improving his crops and growing them to earn a good income from them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 25 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.
Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado de Tierra Alta, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 2 hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Manuel manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de Manuel Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Manuel is a humble farmer and worker; he is 25 years old. He learned how to perform all the diverse farming tasks and jobs from a very young age thanks to his father.

He currently has a banana plantation; his harvests are collected and then sold at the market in Tierra Alta. This work allows him to generate sufficient resources to provide daily sustenance as well as to cover basic home expenses for his wife and their two children.

He is requesting a loan so that he may invest it in the purchase of agricultural supplies wholesale (manure, pesticide, fertilizer). This will permit him to continue caring for his crops and to improve his productivity and yield in the next harvest. In doing this, his income will improve with each sale.

Manuel says that his greatest aspiration is to continue fighting to have a stable income and to offer his family the highest quality of life and wellbeing possible.

Manuel's crops can be maintained and improve with your help!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies wholesale (manure, pesticide, fertilizer)

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio tiene 59 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 14 años en el distrito de Colasay, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Los habitantes de la zona se dedican al comercio, a la agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica al cultivo de café hace más de 05 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha, con esto Demetrio espera mejorar la calidad del café que brindará a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores niveles de ingreso y aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Demetrio, 59, is married and lives with his spouse and his younger son, 14, in the Colasay district of the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.  The residents of that area work primarily in commerce, agriculture, and ranching.

Demetrio has earned a living growing coffee for more than five years.  He has experience in this line of work and very good personal and professional references in the region.

He'll use the loan he requested to buy soil amendments and fertilizer to take care of his crop as well as to contract labor for the harvest season.

Demetrio hopes this will improve the quality of the coffee he sells to his customers, which will generate more income for him and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizer to take care of his crop as well as to pay for labor during the harvest season

loans.name: Sisilia

texts.en:
Sisilia is 43 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 7 children. She does farming and has been in this business for 4 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy a motorcycle and start a motorcycle transport business. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase another motorcycle. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be successful in her business and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ruberlino

texts.es:
Ruberlino tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, vive con su familia en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como gallos, pollos, gallinas, patos, cerdos, etc. su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para aumentar el stock de su negocio así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría. Dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales lo que tendrá gran influencia en el negocio, esto le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ruberlino is 62 years old and married. He lives with his wife and family in the rural part of the district of Oyotún, located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. Life in the district is quiet. The inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

He works raising and selling animals like chickens, roosters, ducks, pigs, etc. His business is located at his house. He has more than 10 years experience in the business and has good personal and labor references from the area. He is requesting a loan to buy more animals to increase the stock of his business as well as make some repairs and do maintenance on the place where he raises the animals. This investment will help him have greater variety and production in animals which will have great impact on his business. It will allow him to increase his level of income and in the end improve the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase the stock of his business and to make repairs and maintenance on the place where he raises them.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling sea shells in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase sea shells to sell in her sea shells business.

Maria has been in this business for 20 years. Maria earns additional income from fishing.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sea shells to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is a widow and has a pension house business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like paints, wood, etc. and to pay for her laborers' salaries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like paints, wood, etc. and to pay for her laborers' salaries

loans.name: Lynna

texts.en:
Lynna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lynna is 46 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lynna has a personal products business in the Philippines. Lynna requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, body lotion, etc.

Lynna has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, body lotion.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanalima operates a stall selling groceries and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
