She offers her products as a street vendor and when a customer makes a request, she tries to satisfy that need to the best of her ability. She shares that it is a simple business to do at her age.

She seeks a loan to buy a stock of yogurts, cheeses, and other dairy products in order to increase her inventory and improve her sales in this Christmas season. The loan will give her the opportunity to capitalize her business and give her a considerable boost in her business, enabling her to obtain resources for her children's university tuition.

loans.use: to buy a stock of yogurts, cheeses, and other dairy products.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 52 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Margaret, 52 years of age and a very hard working, honest, and dedicated farmer. She lives in Mosobeti, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and is blessed with 8 adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 23 years and has gained so much experience.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her large family, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal business.

The Nyamira area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 44 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. He has four children and is married. As a group leader, John is representing his group of six farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of John's desire to have access to the best seed prices. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

John and his group will receive a total of 4 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Un sin número de filas de plantación de tabaco adornan la finca de Félix, un joven de 29 años de edad, quien todos los días despierta muy temprano para cuida de la siembra con la cual sustenta su hogar. Este agricultor de tabaco está apasionado con este mundo desde pequeño, cuando su papá era quien tenía que levantarse a las 5:00 AM a cuidar de su siembra. Hace tres años Félix, junto a sus hermanos han sido los indicados para heredar y seguir con la tradición del cultivo de tabaco.
Félix sueña con llegar a ampliar su terreno, pues quiere que abastecer a distintas empresas de gran importancia donde vive. Por esta razón va a seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar semillas, abono y pagar mano de obra para su próxima cosecha. Esto le permitirá obtener un buen rendimiento y desarrollo de su siembra de tabaco. En sus planes está independizarse más y tener un terreno individual donde pueda emprender con su esposa.
texts.en:
A number of rows of planted tobacco adorns Felix's estate. Felix is a young man, 29, who wakes up early every day to take care of the crops which sustain his home. This farmer has been passionate about this world since childhood, when his father was the one who had to get up at 5am to take care of the crops. Three years ago Felix, along with his brothers, inherited the farm and continue the tradition of cultivating snuff.
Felix dreams of extending their land. He also wants to cater to various major companies where he lives. For this reason, he will continue to invest, and so is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertiliser and to pay for manual labour during their next harvest. This will give a good performance and development of their tobacco. In his plans is more independence and to have his own field that he can undertake with his wife.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser and pay for manual labour.

loans.name: Shee

texts.en:
Shee is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, Shee has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Shee dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice, for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice, for resale

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en:
Vinani is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Vinani owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

Vinani has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mupa operates a groceryand vegetable stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en:
Benson is a 62-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of nine farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Benson has noticed that he has a larger farm group support.

Benson described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize seeds, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy more land to cultivate.

With this loan, Benson’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Melba

texts.es: Melba  de 31 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad a los que apoya con sus estudios. Ella con todo su esfuerzo ha logrado sostener a sus hijos con su venta de pupusas, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus deliciosas pupusas, además ofrece bebidas frías y calientes a sus clientes para ofrecer un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ingresos. Melba desea construir un muro de retención en su vivienda ya que en la entrada de su vivienda se encuentra un muro de tierra que se está desbordando, por lo que ella teme que pueda ocurrir un accidente, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y maya ciclón para construir un muro de retención en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Melba is 31-year old.  She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children, who are 12- and 9- years old respectively.  She supports them in their educations.  Melba uses all her efforts to support her children by selling "pupusas" (stuffed flat breads).  She has had her business for ten years, and as such has a good number of customers who always seek out her delicious "pupusas."  In addition, she offers cold and hot beverages for sale so she can provide better service to her customers and earn a better income.  Melba wants to build a retaining wall for her home, as the current entrance has an earthen wall that is falling apart.  She is worried that it could cause an accident, which is why she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI.  The loan will allow her to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron and hurricane fencing to build her home's retention wall as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and cyclone fencing to build a retention wall for her home.

loans.name: Leon Fredy

texts.es:
Leon, de 49 años, inicio con un negocio de carniceria hace aproximadamente 13 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en su hija y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hija tiene 22 años y se han convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de elementos como un molino de carne y un kit de cuchillos de carnicería. Con estos elementos podrá optimizar su trabajo y mejorar su servicio.

Apoya a Leon para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Leon is 49 years old. He started a butcher business approximately 13 years ago with the goal of finding a business that would generate income in order to be able to survive. Today, he finds his motivation to work in his daughter and in this he wants to provide her the best in her life and development. Today his daughter is 22 years old and she has become the pride of this hard-working man.

He seeks a loan to buy items such as a meat grinder and butcher knife set. With these items he will be able to optimize his work and improve his service.

Support Leon so that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy items such as a meat grinder and butcher knife set.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside actualmente en una aldea del municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y hace 5 años se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos para vender. Vende los cerdos vivos y también destaza para vender la carne, esta actividad la realiza en su casa. Con el fin de tener capital de trabajo para aumentar el negocio ha solicitado otro préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras siendo el segundo ciclo en la institución. con este préstamo va comprar mas cerdos y concentrado o alimento para los mismos. Su meta es lograr construir otra porqueriza y tener cerdos para reproducir y así poder obtener mejores ventas e ingresos para darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Víctor is 29-years old.  He lives with his wife, with whom he has four children.  They currently live in a small town near Morazán, Yoro.  Victor has always made his living in agriculture growing corn.  Five years ago he started raising pigs to sell.  He sells live pigs and also butchers them to sell the meat.  He runs his business out of his home.  With the goal of having working capital to grow his business, Victor has requested another loan for 25,000 Lempiras ($1200 USD), his second loan with the institution.  With the loan, Victor is going to purchase more pigs and animal feed and pellets for them.  His goal is to build another pigpen and have pigs to breed so he can have better sales and an improved income to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed to raise the pigs and fatten them up.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 51-year-old, married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. Her husband is a fisherman. Josefina helps her husband in their fishing business. 

In the photo, Josefina is standing next to a fishing boat.  Josefina is asking to take a loan to buy a boat engine and additional materials for the construction of her fishing boat like plywood, nails, paints and epoxy adhesives. With a loan, Josefina will be able to improve the family's fishing business thus augmenting their income. In the future, Josefina hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine and additional materials for the construction of her fishing boat like plywood, nails, paints and epoxy adhesives.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as God-fearing.

She operates a retail business where she sells dried fish (omena type). She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Carlos Joaquin

texts.es:
Carlos de 23 años de edad estudió hasta bachillerato, es soltero y no tiene hijos vive con sus padres y les ayuda a trabajar para apoyarlos económicamente. Es agricultor desde que tenía 10 años, su padre desde muy joven lo llevo a trabajar al campo para que aprendiera y tuviera como trabajar cuando decidiera formar su familia y mantenerla. La parcela sembrada está ubicada a 10 minutos caminando desde su casa y trabaja de 6:00 am a 12:00 m.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar un ternero, su padre le regalo uno y quiere el otro para adiestrarlos para trabajar y halen la carreta. Así también podrá ofrecer sus servicios y alquilarlos para trabajos agrícolas. Carlos sueña con su pareja de bueyes, no solo para facilitar sus trabajos agrícolas, sino también para que le generen ingresos con el alquiler de estos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23 years old and he completed high school. He is single, does not have any children, and lives with his parents whom he helps support economically. He has been farming since he was 10 years old. He father used to take him to work in the field so that he would learn farming and he would have skills when he decided to form and support a family. The planted land is located 10 minutes walking from his home. He works from 6:00 AM until noon.

He seeks a loan to buy land. His father gave his some land and he wants another parcel to work. In this way he will be able to offer his services and rent them for farming. Carols dreams with his wife of having a pair of oxen, not only to make farming easier but also so that he can generate income by renting them.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano tiene 65 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el distrito de La Matanza, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la venta de frutas como naranja, limón, mango, coco, entre otros. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, etc. La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 15 años, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de frutas para aumentar el stock de su negocio, esto le permitirá ofrecer una mayor variedad de frutas a sus clientes y podrá satisfacer sus gustos y preferencias, incrementando de esta manera su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luciano is 65 years old, lives in his own house in the district of La Matanza, located in the province of Morropón, Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the district is quiet, with villagers engaged in agriculture, livestock and trade as their main economic activities.

He sells fruit like oranges, lemons, mangoes and coconuts, among others. In addition, he raises cattle, sheep and poultry such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc. He has done this for over 15 years and has experience in this business with very good personal and work references in the area. The loan is to purchase a larger quantity of fruits to increase the stock of his business. This will allow him to offer a greater variety of fruits to his customers and be able to suit their tastes and preferences, thus increasing his income and so improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to improve the stock of his business.

loans.name: Rianto

texts.en:
Rianto is a 32-year-old man married to Jane who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with four children.  Rianto has been operating a retail business shop for a period of five years, earning himself an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.
  
Rianto is now servicing his second loan of KES 35,000 and intends to use this amount to buy sugar, rice, tea leaves, detergents, wheat and maize flour to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

Rianto plans to use the anticipated income to pay his children's school fees and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, cooking fat, detergents and wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Al- Ahlam Al- Saghira Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Ahlam Al- Saghira. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Muna is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, living with her family in a humble house in Sana'a city, Yemen. She is a student in the highest level of Secondary school education. She hopes to get a high degree to study a good major in the University.

Muna is a very active and clever woman and she wants to learn computer programs and applications to help her through her studying in the University. Her husband is the breadwinner of the family but his income is not enough to buy a laptop for his wife. For this reason, Muna applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a laptop to use for her studies. Muna hopes to get a high degree in the last level of Secondary education and study a good specialization in the University.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to use in her studies.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ice cream business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream-making business.

Jona successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Jona's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream-making business.

loans.name: Choka

texts.en:
Choka is married and has seven children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past eight years Choka has operated a coconut and fruit selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Choka is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of coconuts and fruits to sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of  coconut and fruits to sell in her business.

loans.name: Gloria Eliana

texts.es:
La socia Gloria Eliana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras,arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gloria Eliana continue working her food business. She is an enterprising woman who through this business wants to enable her children to finish school. Her dream is to have a large restaurant. She seeks a loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat. She is happy for the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman. She has two children who are 10 and 12 years old. She describes herself as faithful and open minded. She operates a wholesale shop where she sells masking tape. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She says her biggest business challenge is delay in getting stock. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of masking tape. Her business goal is to open more business branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of masking tape

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail shop where she sells potatoes, onions and carrots. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of potatoes, carrots, onions. Her business goal is to have increased profits within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of potatoes, carrots and onions.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. Her business is located in an area with potential for growth, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to add more stock. 

She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a dressmaker from Leyte, Philippines. She is a 58-year-old married woman and has been in the dressmaking business for several years now.  Violeta is asking to take a loan to buy materials like cloth, thread, needles, scissors and others. With this, she will be able to sew more dress to sell, thus augmenting her income. In the future, Violeta has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials like cloth, thread, needles, scissors and others

loans.name: Julian Andres

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Julian es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
El prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su esposa e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos, materia prima y un carro de comidas, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos él podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Julian's perseverance and courage, his household can have a respectable life.

Julian prepares and sells fast food in Medellín. He learned the business out of a desire to look for a new source of income to support his family.

His wife and children are his main motivation to work every day and put forth the effort to make each day a better one. Julian wants to drive his business forward by purchasing supplies, raw materials and a food cart. Corporación Interactuar and the Kiva lenders can give his business that push forward. With the above listed items, Julian will be able to have his food available for his customers at all times. Julian's greatest dream is to have a restaurant in the same location, so as not to lose his customers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, raw materials and a food cart.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is 47 years old and married. He loves his children very much and tries to provide them with a good upbringing. He is a kind and hardworking man. According to his friends’ opinion, Arif is very outgoing and welcoming. He lives in in the Agsu region. 

He couldn’t get higher education and because of that he decided to start his own business. For that he chose farming. He is growing fruits and vegetables in his own yard. Arif has 27 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, but Arif's situation is very challenging. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes that a problem for him. Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. 

He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various shop merchandise

loans.name: Cavid

texts.en:
Cavid is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Sabirabad with his family. He has been working in a shop for three years. He sells foodstuffs. His father helps him in this business. He enjoys providing good service to clients.

In Sabirabad the weather is very cold. Cavid grows some trees in front of his shop, but he has one problem: a lack of water. He can't irrigate the trees without water. He needs to have water in his shop. Cavid applied for a 700 AZN loan from Kiva. He hopes lenders help him.

loans.use: To install water lines to irrigate his trees

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is a married man from Leyte, Philippines. He earns a living through his hog-raising business. Jaime has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Jaime is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed. This loan will enable Jaime to improve his hog-raising business, thus improving his income and profit. In the future, Jaime has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is sari-sari store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She is 61 years old and has been engaged in the grocery retail business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Fe is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, condiments, rice and snack foods. This loan will enable Fe to augment her stocks thus attracting more buyers into her store. In the future, Fe hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory of photocopying and photography materials.

loans.name: Anilu

texts.es:
Anilu tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio, ganadería y agricultura.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cuyes, cerdos, gallinas, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales con gran influencia en su negocio, con esto Anilu espera incrementar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anilu is 24 years old and has a partner and two children. She lives with her family in a rural zone in the Cayaltí district, which is situated in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. Life in this district is peaceful, with the inhabitants working mainly in commerce, farming and ranching.

Anilu farms and sells animals including ducks, hens, roosters, chickens and pigs from her business at her own home. She has over five years experience with this business, and has good personal and professional references in the area. 

This loan will be to buy more animals, such as pigs, guinea pigs and hens to increase her business' stock. The loan will mean that she will have more variety and higher productivity from her animals, which will greatly influence the business. Anilu hopes that this will increase her income and finally improve her quality of live as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as pigs, guinea pigs and hens to increase her business' stock.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a 49-year-old married man and a father of six children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Renato has been engaged in a sewing business for more than 20 years now. He is also into rice farming. 

Renato is asking to take a loan to buy sewing materials such as cloth, needles, thread, scissors and others. This loan will enable him to sew more, thus allowing him to cater to more customers in his shop. 

In the future, Renato hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as cloth, needles, thread, scissors and others

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 24 years old. She is married and supports no children yet.

Faith runs a retail shop, a business she has done for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of Kshs 50,000.

Faith has requested for her second loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 30,000, which she will use to increase her stock of pork meat for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Faith will be able to expand her business further.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a flourishing life.

loans.use: to increase her stock of retail goods.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his early forties, is married with four children who are still in school. He has been a tailor and also manages a shop selling clothes-making materials. Joseph has been in this business since 2002 and is able to make a fair monthly profit. He does business from 7:00 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. per working day.

This will be his fourth loan request from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy clothes-making materials and a tailoring machine for his business. He wants to grow his capital to be able to expand his business.

Joseph will share this loan with his loan group, Tumaini, which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes-making materials and a tailoring machine for his business.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, cooking oil, uices and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area with potential for growth, and her primary customers are regular ones. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to add more stock. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, juices, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, juices, soap and other items

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su padre, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder seguir continuando con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her father. She sells clothing for men and ladies from her home and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes wholesale so that she can continue with her work, and can thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a married man. He has two children. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes tables, chairs and other furniture. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to add more stock. 

He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful in business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fish (omena type). She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. 

Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children well. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia, a sus 20 años es soltera y vive con sus padres. Desde que tenía 16 años, ella comenzó a laborar en el campo de la confección, pues le colaboraba a una Tía que tenía una empresa grande y allí se encargaba de pulir y revisar las prendas, cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad fue vinculada a la empresa, donde laboró por algunos años. 

Hace aproximadamente 2 años, Yesenia se independizó y montó su taller con gran empuje; afianzó su taller con la esperanza de que las ventas aumentaran y así fue, comenzó a conseguir contratos con terceros. De esta forma ha obtenido los ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 

Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar una máquina ojaladora, con el fin de brindarle a sus clientes una prenda bien elaborada y con excelente terminación, así aumentará los contratos y podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una línea propia, además de brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras  personas. 

Ella sabe que Interactuar es un gran apoyo para el crecimiento de su empresa!
texts.en:
Yesenia is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Since she was 16 years old she began to work as a seamstress with an aunt who had a large business and there she worked finishing and reviewing clothing items. When she turned 18 she left the business where she had worked for a few years. Approximately 2 years ago Yesenia opened her own shop with great effort; she was confident in her workshop that the sales would increase and they did. She began to obtain contracts. In this way she obtained the income to support her family.

With the loan she seeks she wishes to buy a button hole making machine, with the goal of providing her customers a well-made clothing item and with excellent finishing. In this way her contracts will grow and she will be able to generate more income in order to be able to accomplish her dream of having her own clothing line, in addition to providing opportunities for employment to other people. She knows that Interactuar is a great support for the growth of her business!

loans.use: to buy a button hole making sewing machine.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 37 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is 46 years old, married, and she has three kids. 

Naila is a businesswoman. She is earning a good income from selling clothes, so she is still happy to do her business. 

For the third time, she is asking for a loan. Naila is very thankful and very pleased with the Kiva lenders for supporting and helping her to realize her dreams over and over again. This time Naila is requesting a loan in order to purchase winter clothes, bags, and other things to sell.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes, bags, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos es una mujer de 55 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 21 años de edad al que ha logrado sacar adelante sola. Ella pone todo su esfuerzo y tenacidad para salir adelante con su negocio de venta de pupusas actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años en una zona de mucha afluencia de personas.  Santos desea realizar mejoras a las paredes de su vivienda, repellándolas para que estas tengan una mejor apariencia y mayor resistencia en épocas de lluvia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: cemento, arena y mano de obra para repellar las paredes de su vivienda lo antes posible y así aprovechar la época seca para realizar la mejora.
texts.en:
Santos, 55 years old, lives in her own home with her 21-year-old son whom she's been able to raise alone.

She puts all her efforts and determination into getting ahead with her business of selling pupusas [stuffed corn tortillas]. She's been doing this work for five years in a very busy, crowded area.

Santos wants to repair the walls of her home, plastering for better finish and better resistance to rainy weather. 

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement and sand, as well as payment for labor to plaster the walls as soon as possible thus taking advantage of the dry weather to complete the repair.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and to pay for labor to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a 65-year-old married woman living in Leyte, Philippines. She has made a living through her hog raising business for several years now. 

Bonifacia is asking to take out a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With a loan, Bonifacia will be able to raise more pigs, thus allowing her to sell more pigs in the market after several weeks.   

In the future, Bonifacia hopes to make her business successful and productive.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a welding business where he makes metallic gates, doors, windows, etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances to buy more stock. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of welding materials. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be successful in business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of welding materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique tiene 46 años conviviente, conocido en el medio, por su labor de engorde y venta de ganado vacuno. Vive en casa propia con hijo y sin carga familiar. Luis Enrique es persona con buenas referencias. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Habitada por gente trabajadora, que se dedican a la agricultura y ganaderia.

Luis Enrique se dedica al engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, desde hace más de 05 años, de manera continua. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de cerdos y comida para estos para de esa manera generar mayor ingreso mensual a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique, 46, is living with someone in his own home with his son and without any family responsibility.  He's known in the area for his work fattening and selling cattle.  Luis Enrique has good references and his family is close.  He lives in a community in the Saña district of the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The hardworking people there earn a living in agriculture and ranching.

Luis Enrique has earned a living fattening and selling cattle continuously for more than five years.  He also raises and sells small animals.

He needs a loan to invest in buying pigs and pig feed to earn a higher monthly income for his family.

loans.use: to invest in pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Segundo Polidoro

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal.

El se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción (ladrillo), además su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como gallinas, pavos y patos. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años, contando con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El presente crédito será para la compra de leña y tierra para la elaboración de los ladrillos, así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde trabaja. Con esto Segundo espera brindar un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes incrementando de esta manera su nivel de ventas lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 55 years old, has a common-law wife, and lives in his own house in the Buenos Aires district, located in Morropon province in the Piura region of Peru's north coast. Life in the district is tranquil and its residents devote their time to agriculture and cattle-raising to sustain themselves.

Segundo sells construction materials (mainly bricks) and in addition, his wife raises corral birds such as hens, turkeys and ducks. He has dedicated himself to this activity for more than 10 years, and can count on experience in the business with fixed customers who offer very good personal and work references.

The present loan is for purchasing firewood and earth to make more bricks, and also, to repair the location where he works. With this loan, Segundo hopes to offer his customers a product of better quality, increasing in this manner his sales and his income, and finally, his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: buy firewood and earth for making bricks, and to make repairs on the location where he works.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single woman. She has one child who is nine years old. She describes herself to be obedient. 

Joyce operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to add more stock. 

Joyce will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will improve tremendously.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a married man, and he has one child who is four years old. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

Meshack operates a photocopying and printing business. He has been involved in this business for two years, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to add more stock. 

Meshack will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of photocopying papers, cartridges, etc. His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will excel in business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of photocopying papers and cartridges

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be enterprising. 

He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of timber. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of timber and other carpentry materials. 

His business goal is to have increased profits within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of timber and other carpentry materials

loans.name: Archiel

texts.en:
Archiel is 28 years old and married with one kid in school.

Archiel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Archiel aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Odilia Teresa

texts.es:
Odilia es una mujer luchadora que trabaja incansablemente para alcanzar su desarrollo personal; ella vive sola porque no tiene hijos y está soltera. Ella tiene 51 años de edad.

Ella se dedica con mucha entrega y entusiasmo a la compraventa de ropa típica en la comunidad donde vive; la labor lo realiza en su casa de habitación; ella empezó a ejercer esta actividad desde muy joven porque le gustaba tejer y lo aprendió de sus padres; lleva a cabo esta actividad porque es el medio que le ayuda a generar los ingresos económicos necesarios para su  sustento. En estos años se ha dado cuenta que esta actividad tiene mucha demanda, principalmente en su comunidad porque todas las personas que viven cerca de ella utilizan este tipo de vestimenta.
 
El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo que solicita es la compra de cortes(vestimenta típica).

Uno de sus principales anhelos o sueños es que en un futuro sus ganancias incrementen y contar con un local exclusivo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Odilia, 51, is a determined woman who works tirelessly to reach her personal goals.  She lives alone because she's single and has no children.

She devotes herself with a lot of effort and enthusiasm buying and selling traditional clothing in the community where she lives.  She does this job in her home.  She started when she was very young because she liked to weave and she learned it from her family.  She does this work because it's the way she helps earn the income she needs to support herself.  Lately she has realized that there's a lot of demand for this job, mainly in her community where everyone who lives near her wears this type of clothing.

Odilia's going to use the loan to buy "cortes" (traditional skirts).

One of her main desires or dreams is that her profits will increase in the future and she'll have a retail space exclusively for her business.

loans.use: to buy "cortes" (traditional skirts)

loans.name: Reina Procedis

texts.es:
Reina de 45 años de edad estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica, es casada y su esposo actualmente no trabaja porque recién acaba de llegar del extranjero donde vivió por seis años. Tiene tres hijos pero solo dos viven con ella y le apoyan económicamente.

Reina se dedica al comercio de ropa de forma ambulante. Todos los días desde la mañana inicia el recorrido por todas las calles de su comunidad buscando posibles clientes interesados en adquirir su mercadería, dicha profesión la inició cuando nació su primer hijo y debía obtener mayores ingresos para mantenerlo.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar mercadería y especialmente la necesita porque tiene demanda de clientes que sufren problemas de obesidad y necesitan ropa especial para ellos y esta es más cara y cuesta más conseguir, por lo que necesita el dinero para cubrir  la necesidad de dichas personas.

Reina sueña que su negocio se vuelva toda una empresa de ropa estable y así poder darle todo el estudio a su hija para que llegue a ser una mujer profesional.
texts.en:
Reina is 45 years old, married and studied through the sixth grade. Currently, her husband does not work because he just returned from out of the country where he lived for six years. She has three children but only two of them live with her and they help her financially.

Reina works selling clothes in the streets. Each day starting in the morning, she walks all the streets of her community looking for possible customers who may be interested in buying her merchandise. She started doing this when her first son was born because she needed to make more income to be able to support him.

The loan she requests is to buy merchandise.  In particular she has a demand for clothing items for customers who suffer from obesity. It is more difficult for them to find clothes and it is more expensive. She needs the money to help meet the needs of these people. Reina dreams of turning her work into a stable clothing business and that way be able to provide her daughter with an education so that she can become a professional woman.

loans.use: to buy special clothing for people who are overweight.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 34 years old and married with five children, who are all in school. Irene works very hard to provide for them.

Irene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Irene would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a widowed woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be humbled, and a risk taker. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delays in orders. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Igrasya

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Igrasya works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Igrasya is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall for her vegetable vending business.

Igrasya has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Sam is a 39-year-old man. He is married with three children, all of whom go to school. He is a first-time borrower from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. and a resident of Gganda, a rural area. He is a poultry farmer in the city outskirts.

He intends to take a loan of UGX 3,000,000 so that he can expand his chicken pen and add stock of chicks in his poultry business.

He is so grateful for the support given to them as low-income earners. His future plan is to expand his poultry business and venture into broilers, since he is now rearing layers only. He advises fellow farmers to be resilient in all businesses.

Pictured are Sam with his wife in the part of their house where they are going to construct the chicken pen.

loans.use: to expand his chicken pen and buy stock of poultry birds to sell.

loans.name: Fikira

texts.en:
Fikira is a married woman with two children who attend school and are under her care. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For over five years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids’ wear clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids' wear clothes for resale.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, a housewife, is need of a loan for her husband so that he can refurbish and expand his restaurant. 

Shazia is blessed with four children, and she aims at getting them educated with the funds generated from this restaurant.

The items required include furniture which can be bifurcated into tables and chairs, groceries which can be further divided into vegetables and meat, plus a new gas cylinder.

This loan is pivotal for Shazia, as it would help her enhance her husband's earnings with the expansion of his restaurant, simultaneously fulfilling her aim of getting a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Fulvia Rosa

texts.es:
Fulvia es una amante de los niños, tanto así que desde hace 13 años monto un negocio en el cual ofrece el servicio de guardería y cuidado de niños, esta certificada para esta labor y su gran motivación es el amor que siente por los infantes.

Es casada y madre de tres hijos mayores que en algunas ocasiones le ayudan en su negocio.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de implementos de cocina y de aseo como ollas grandes, vajillas y detergentes suaves.

Con estos elementos podrá cuidar a sus niños de la mejor manera posible y dará tranquilidad a los padres.
texts.en:
Fulvia loves children so much that she began her business of nursery and day care service 13 years ago.
She is certified for the job and her biggest motivation is the love she feels for the toddlers.

She is married and mother of three grown-up children that sometimes help out in her business.

Fulvia is asking for the loan so as to buy supplies for cooking and washing, such as large pans, tableware and mild detergents.

loans.use: to buy supplies for cooking and washing such as large pans.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be creative and faithful.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay in getting stock.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to open other business branches within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Simira

texts.en:
Simira is 56 years old and married with 4 kids. They are IDP (internally displaced persons) from their native land Füzuli city for 22 years. 

Simira has raised cows for 30 years. She buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in the local bazaar. Today, she wants to buy two calves for her  farm. For this reason, she needs 1,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) and therefore she has applied to Aqroinvest Credit Union for a loan. 

She says that she is thankful to Kiva for the help. In the future, she wishes to develop her business and increase her income. Please support Simira.

loans.use: to buy two calves for her farm.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is from Leyte, Philippines.

She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various products like food items and others. Zenaida has been in the business for more than five years now. She also earns additional income through a hog-raising business.

Zenaida is requesting to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, dried fish, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, dried fish, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. 

She earns an income through her food vending business. Gemma sells home cooked snack foods like rice cakes and steamed cassava. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Gemma is asking to take a loan to buy piglets to raise. With a loan she will be able to improve her hog raising business. 

In the future, Gemma hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She is a rice retailer. She wants to invest in another business to earn an income. 

Marlina is asking to take a loan to buy piglets to raise as well as more rice to sell.  This loan will enable her to improve her business, thus augmenting her income. 

In the future, Marlina hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise as well as more rice to sell

loans.name: Chhorm

texts.en:
Chhorm, 51, lives in a small community of Siem Reap Province. He has four children in total; one is single and lives under his support while the other three are married and live independently. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business on farmland which is located near his house. He has been involved in this business since 1990. He is able to earn a daily income of USD 5 on average.

Chhorm would like to improve his living standards by having clean energy for household use. Because of his lack of capital, he is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and will reduce smoke from wood or charcoal. 

He is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a better interest rate than for its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. He is a 44-years-old who farms corn and operates a fish pond for an income. These have been his business for three years now. 

Ramil is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy supplies to keep his crops healthy, such as fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, and more seedlings; also he will pay for labor on the fish pond maintenance. Ramil dreams of maximizing his land's output and expanding his fish pond for a better income. 

In the future, he hopes to make his business more successful. His profit will be for food, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticide, and to pay the labor fee for fish pond maintenance

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man. He describes himself to be goal oriented. He operates a salon where he offers beauty services. His primary customers are ladies. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital to buy beauty products. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy hair weaves, braids, and other beauty products for salon use. He hopes that in the future, he will have a family that is financially stable. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stocks of beauty products.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, braids, and other beauty products

loans.name: Davina

texts.en:
Davina is thankful that she was granted a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.
 
She would like to again apply for another loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a good harvest on her pineapple farm. She is thanking God and you in advance for the fruits of her labor and the financial help that will be given to her. She is wishing everyone a Blessed Christmas! 

Davina dreams of her farm growing and yielding more harvest. She prays for good health and to have a happy and prosperous life for her family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Athanas

texts.en:
Athanas is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a farm where he keeps goats and ducks and also grows vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular and loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more ducks, goats, and farm inputs. 

His business goal is to have a big farm within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have many farms. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more goats and ducks.

loans.use: buy more ducks, goats, and farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of towels, duvets, and bed sheets.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy is bread vendor from Moalboal, Cebu. He is 42 years old, married and has four children. Roy uses his motorcycle to transport bread to his customers. Roy is asking to take a loan to buy more bread to sell. A loan will help him improve his stock, thus allowing him to sell more to his customers. In the future, Roy hopes of building his own bakeshop.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Eusilah

texts.en:
Eusilah has a tailoring shop and has been running her business for 10 years. She is 36 years old and is a single mother of 2 children. 

Eusilah will use her loan to buy a sewing machine and an overlock machine (serger) to use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to boost her business with the purchase of sewing materials such as textiles and thread. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and, in the future, Eusilah hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy 2 sewing machines.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be God fearing. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stocks of shoes

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Concepcion works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal-retailing and pig -attening businesses. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 50 years old and is married with 5 children. 3 of her children are in school.

Florenda earns a living by growing sugarcane in the Philippines. She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Florenda has been farming sugarcane for 20 years, though she also earns additional income from running a general store.

Florenda is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Laida

texts.en:
Laida is 50 years old and married with three children, who are all in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Laida is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Laida has been farming sugarcane for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend from school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Josephine has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. In addition, she operates a retail shop at the market where there are passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy shampoo, hair braids, hair lotions, and weaves for her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair braids, hair lotions, and weaves for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Yamba

texts.en:
Yamba is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan of KES 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in accounting.

loans.name: Kyon Thin Village

texts.en:
This community is located in Myanmar, in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 18 village customers. This loan will help them purchase ducks as well as high quality feeds ($45 per packet and a week's feed for 100 ducks). When they eat the duck food and small fishes from the lake, 50% of the ducks on average lay eggs every day. As the price of the eggs always fluctuates, the income isn’t always same for each household. 

Kyon Thin Village has over 900 villagers and many of them are farmers. Some villagers have grocery stores at their home and they also raise ducks, pigs, and chickens as livestock. For additional income, villagers do fishing and sell at other nearby villages or towns.

The above pictures shows the CBO leaders from the Kyon Thin Village, named as U Toe, U That, U Win, Daw Myint and U Phoe. Included in the picture, U Toe (second from left) is 27 years old and he is married, having a daughter. He farms at his one-acre crop farm and take cares of their 150 ducks and 2 pigs.  His wife looks after the small grocery shop opened at their home and sometimes helps U Toe in farming. 

With Proximity's loan, he will buy better feeds for the ducks to increase his egg output and thus income.

loans.use: purchase ducks as well as high quality feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of milk

loans.name: Maira Araceli

texts.es:
Maira, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar aves de corral de poca edad y concentrado para alimentarlas, así su granja continuara funcionado.
Con la facilidad de tener recursos económicos que le dio el préstamo anterior Maira ha aumentado el número de aves de corral y mejoró la forma de cuidarlas. Dentro de su núcleo familiar las necesidades básicas están siendo cubiertas y tiene mejor situación económica.
texts.en: Maira is in need of a new loan to purchase young poultry and food to feed them with, so that her farm can stay in business. The previous loan gave Maira the financial means to increase the number of poultry she has and improve the way she cares for them. She's now covering her immediate family's basic needs and is in a better position financially.

loans.use: To purchase young poultry and food to feed them with, so that her farm can stay in business.

loans.name: Martha Ligia

texts.es:
Martha ha tenido que soportar el duro verdugo del desplazamiento a causa de la violencia, ella vivía en una vereda y se vio en la obligación de trasladarse hasta Turbo en busca de una nueva oportunidad de vida para ella y sus hijos lejos de la violencia, la sangre y las balas.

Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo bebidas como gaseosas, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para sus hijos.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de surtido de bebidas para mejorar su inventario y poder seguir soñando con un mejor futuro para su familia.

Con este préstamo para ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.

Hoy en día es una mujer fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Martha had to endure the hardships of displacement because of the violence. She lived on the sidewalk and was obligated to move to Turbo in search of a new opportunity for living for her and her children, far from the violence, blood and bullets.

Today she lives in a humble house and makes her living selling drinks such as soft drinks. She learned this business by doing it in an effort to obtain subsistence for her children. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying an assortment of drinks to increase her inventory and be able to continue to dream of a better future for her family. With this loan she can offer her products and increase her sales considerably. Today she is a strong woman with a great entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of drinks to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 46 years old, a married woman and a mother of 3 children. 

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations at her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors, and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn is a 55-year-old, widowed mother with five grown-up children. She lives in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. Four of her children are factory workers, and they have worked in the factory since 2010, making USD 20 a day. 

Now Morn would like to request a loan for her daughter to buy clothes to sell. With the loan, her daughter will be able to generate more finances for the family. 

The next thing that Morn would like to do is to build a new bathroom with a toilet for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her daughter to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 29-year-old single man from Nablus city. He lives with his parents in a small simple house. His father is very old and he can't work anymore.

Ibrahim is a student in a local university where he studies business administration. One year ago, he opened a small coffee shop to support his family and also pay education expenses. 

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new coffee machine for his coffee shop. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to improve his business and increase the sales. Ibrahim appeared in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy a new coffee machine for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a resident of Leyte, Philippines. She is 41 years old, married and has four children.

Marife has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than 10 years now. She is also engaged in rice farming. Marife is requesting a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm and animal feed for the pigs. Marife believes that this loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm as well as her hog raising business.

In the future, Marife has hopes of making her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm and animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is a 59-year-old married mother of 2 grown children from Moalboal, Cebu in the Philippines. She has been engaged in her hog raising business for more than 20 years now. This is her sole source of income. However, her husband also earns additional income through farming. 

Silveria is requesting a loan to buy both animal feed and piglets to raise. This loan will enable her to raise a greater number of healthy pigs which she will be able to sell after several weeks.

In the future, Silveria hopes to make her hog raising venture a success.
