loans.use: to buy animal feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is married and has two children. She is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. Dilbar began her own business dealing in animal husbandry 20 years ago. She requested a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains and beans.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto, utiliza los préstamos para ir mejorando su negocio y tener su fuente de ingresos estable, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar un cerdo y cubrir los gastos de recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos. Podrá abastecer a sus clientes y brindar una mejor alimentación a su familia.
Con ayuda del préstamo anterior ha logrado mantener la sostenibilidad de su negocio, mejorar su situación económica y cambiar el nivel de vida.
texts.en: Edilberto uses loans to improve his business and to have a stable source of income. He is applying for a new loan to buy a pig and cover the costs of harvesting basic grains. He will be able to supply his customers and offer a better food supply to his family. With the help of his previous loan, he managed to maintain the sustainability of his business, improve his financial situation, and change his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a pig and cover the costs of harvesting basic grains.

loans.name: Kimngabuni

texts.en:
Kimngabuni is 69 years old and married to Ann, and they are blessed with four children who are all adults. He has had a farming business for the last 35 years and earns a profit of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 7,000 to buy seven energy saving Jiko stoves. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy energy saving Jiko stoves

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley has a motorcycle transportation business and has been in the business for six years now. He is 28 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

Stanley will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying another motorcycle. 

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. His hopes and dreams for the future are to succeed in his business and to be able to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Jane is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Wuili Adonys

texts.es:
Un viejo pizarrón y un escritorio son los testigos silenciosos de 14 años de trabajó con varias generaciones de niños a los cuales les ha tratado de transmitir sus conocimientos, Wuili, nunca desistió sus sueños y espera terminar su carrera Magisterio, para poder seguir impartiendo clases que ha sido su principal meta transmitir y ayudar a todos esos niños a buscar un futuro certero, lleno de valores y educación.  Wuili se caracteriza por ser una persona esforzada ya que él ha sido quien se ha facilitado sus estudios, no abandonando sus sueños. 
Wuili solicita el crédito para la compra de equipos tecnológicos, una computadora y un proyector, estos le serán de gran ayuda en facilitar su trabajo y realizarlo de una manera más eficiente, tratando de dejar el tradicionalismo y adentrarse en las nuevas tecnologías que ofrecen un gran campo y que además le permitirá al mismo tiempo enseñarle a los niños. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que le permitirá involucrarse en un nuevo campo.
texts.en:
An old blackboard and desk are the silent witnesses of 14 years of work with different generations of children, upon whom Wuili has tried to impart his knowledge.

Wuili continues to pursue his dreams and hopes to finish his master's degree, so as to continue giving classes as this, helping children find a certain future, filled with values and education, is his main goal.

Wuili is a vigorous person and has paid for his studies himself, while never abandoning his dreams.

He is asking for the loan to buy technical equipment, a computer and a projector, as these would facilitate his classes and make them more efficient, leaving behind more traditional methods and giving him and the children the possibility of becoming comfortable with the new technologies.

He is putting his confidence in the loan as this will allow him to engage in the new field.

loans.use: to buy technical equipment; a computer and a projector.

loans.name: Sreythol's Group

texts.en: Sreythol, 24, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Speu Province, and is a mother of one kid. Sreythol earns income by growing rice crops and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has involved this business for ages and earns about 40,000 KHR per day. This is the first time for Sreythol to take a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve the health of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna is a 40-year-old mother of two children living in Kampong Cham Province. 

She earns income to support her family living conditions through rice cropping and by working for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. 

Sokna hopes that through this she can get more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
Nataly es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos cosméticos y de cuidado personal. Inicio el negocio hace 1 años y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospera. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como cremas y ungüentos.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Nataly is fully ready to face the world and have a full life thanks to her efforts. She has a store where she sells cosmetics and personal care products. She started her business a year ago, and in spite of having been open for a short time, it has been well-received in the neighborhood.

She wants to offer a wider variety of products and increase her sales by injecting capital into her business. That is why she is requesting this loan, so that she can give herself a chance to become more prosperous. She will invest the money in purchasing merchandise she doesn't currently carry, such as creams and ointments.

She has high hopes for her business and believes her future can improve substantially with the support of organizations like Interactuar, that do what they can for people to be able to aspire to a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise like creams and ointments.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 50-year-old, married woman. She is in the hand embroidery business. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors. along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishments. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to be able to increase her income by targeting more customers.

She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones as embellishments for her hand embroidery to cater to more customers consistently.

loans.name: Yoni Humberto

texts.es:
Yoni se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de cerrajería y soldadura de metal, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 

Ya que ha laborado 11 meses con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una máquina para corte de metal.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que la herramienta que utiliza esta en mal estado. 

Actualmente es soltero y es padre de una hija de 9 años a quien siempre trata de ayudar económicamente. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a un joven emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Yoni works successfully in his business, a locksmith and metal shop. He is very well-known in his neighborhood for his good work and service.

He has worked for 11 months with the knowledge he acquired from his work in various workshops. He has had the opportunity to maintain his job and he has tried to improve his family's living conditions. For this reason, he would like to apply for a loan to buy a machine to cut metal. With these elements, he will be able to continue offering his services, since the machine he currently uses is in bad shape.

He is currently single and is the father of a nine-year-old daughter, whom he always tries to help financially.

His greatest dream is to be able to have a big workshop with various employees, and he will be able to accomplish his goal little by little.

Help a young entrepreneur with a desire to succeed with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a machine to cut metal.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband.

She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces for meeting the orders on time. It will help her to make a good amount of income for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces for meeting the orders on time.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar  is a 36-year-old married mother of 3 children. She has been running her livestock buy-and-sell business for many years, with support from her husband. 

Kousar earns a good amount from this business which helps her provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Though, she also sells milk in her area to generate extra income. 

Now, Kousar has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR in order to purchase more cattle for resale in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all of her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market in an effort to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 48 years old, a married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. 

She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 3 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales and earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales

loans.name: Chuachinup, Sector Adoquinado Group

texts.es:
Diego (representante del grupo) es un hombre tenaz, luchador y con una visión clara de la vida; él trabaja muy duro para alcanzar sus sueños. A sus 31 años tiene todo el deseo y la energía de salir adelante.

Él  se dedica a la compraventa de ropa típica en la comunidad donde vive; la labor lo realiza en su casa de habitación y en comunidades vecinas; empezó a ejercer esta actividad hace 3 años y lo aprendió de sus padres y amigos; lleva a cabo esta actividad porque es el medio que le ayuda a generar los ingresos económicos necesarios para su  sustento. En estos años se ha dado cuenta que esta actividad tiene mucha demanda, principalmente en su comunidad porque todas las personas que viven cerca de ella utilizan este tipo de vestimenta.
 
El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo que solicita es la compra de más ropa típica. 

Uno de sus principales anhelos o sueños es que en un futuro sus ganancias incrementen y construir otra casa.
texts.en:
Diego (representative of the group) is a strong, determined man with a clear vision in life; he works very hard to reach his dreams. At 31 years of age he has all the desire and the energy to succeed. 

He works buying and selling traditional clothing in the community where he lives. He works from his house and in neighbouring communities. He began this enterprise three years ago and learnt from his parents and his friends. This activity allows him to generate the income necessary to sustain him. During these years he has realised that there is great demand for this clothing in his local area as everyone who lives close to him wears this type of garment.

He will use the loan he is asking for to buy more traditional clothing.

One of his main wishes or dreams is that in the future his profits will increase and he can build another house.

.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Pachacutec Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PACHACUTEC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa ella es conviviente y tiene 66 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de internet.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Pachacutec" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Rosa, 66, is in a common-law relationship and has one child. She works in her business, a grocery store, and also has a business selling fish. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is applying for this loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo asked for permission to take their photos after the group meeting for work-related reasons.

The other members of this group have businesses selling food and clothing, a grocery store, and an Internet business.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Manuel Jr

texts.en:
Manuel Jr is from Leyte, Phillipines and is the married father of an 11-year-old son. He runs a small sari-sari, or retail store, selling various goods and items to the people in his area. 

Manuel Jr is requesting a loan in order to buy more stock of canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, and snack foods. This loan will help him improve his inventory and thus attract more customers to his store. 

In the future, Manuel Jr dreams of making his business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, and snack foods.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima De Quellomayo Group

texts.es:
La socia Victoria pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DE FATIMA DE QUELLOMAYO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Victoria tiene 46 años de edad tiene 07 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia cultiva lo que son frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Member Victoria belongs to the communal bank Virgen De Fatima De Quellomayo. This bank is located in the district of Echarate, in La Convención province, department of Cusco.

Member Victoria is 46 years old, has seven children, and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities and her work as a farmer. She has been working in this business for a long time, and things are going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her daily work. This member wants to be able to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. She grows fruit crops like oranges, bananas, and others, and this is her means to provide for her family.

This member is requesting this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms. 

The other members of this group also work farming and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is the owner of a sari-sari, or variety store, from Albuera, Leyte in the Philippines. She started her business 3 years ago and earns 4,000 PHP each month. Aside from running her store, she also cooks and sells barbecue in the evening for additional income. 

Josephine would like to expand her business, but she has limited funds. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP in order to buy inventory such as chips, candies, canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, seasonings, cooking oil, coffee, and sugar. 

Josephine's income will be used for both her family's daily consumption and the school fees for her 6 dependents, aged between 2 and 18 years. 

Josephine is 42 years old and dreams of someday having a higher-earning business.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, seasonings, cooking oil, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 13,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, canned goods and other grocery items which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable enough source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Janet dreams of having a big Grocery Store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her store's inventory

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has been making a living through her rice retail business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Mary Ann is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. With a loan, Mary Ann will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

In the future, Mary Ann hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Veronica Beatriz

texts.es:
Verónica, utilizo el préstamo anterior para fortalecer la venta de panes con pollo, hot dog, bebidas otras meriendas, actualmente tienen un negocio mejor establecido, su experiencia en la administración de su negocio ha mejorado, cuenta con clientes satisfechos y está comprando electrodomésticos para su hogar.
Como ya es costumbre para Verónica cada temporada de fin de año también vende ropa para ambos sexos, en esta oportunidad se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar faldas, trajes para niños/as, camisas, pantalones, etc., con ello podrá tener ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Verónica used her previous loan to strengthen her sales of breads with chicken, hot dogs, drinks, and other snacks. Currently, she has a better established business, her experience in running her business has improved, and she has satisfied customers. She is buying small appliances for her household.

As is customary for Verónica every holiday season, she also sells clothing for both genders. At this time, she has decided on another loan to buy skirts, children's outfits, shirts, pants, etc. This will enable her to have extra income.

loans.use: to buy skirts, children's outfits, shirts, pants, etc. This will enable her to have extra income.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, ve en los  créditos una herramienta útil para mejorar el inventario de su negocio por lo que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar fardos de ropa usada y nueva para ambos sexos (adultos y niños/as), así cubrirá demandas de sus clientes en esta época de buenas ventas.
El financiamiento anterior le ha ayudado a mantener la continuidad de la venta de ropa, sus ingresos son mayores y las circunstancias familiares están cambiando positivamente.
texts.en:
María sees loans as a useful tool to improve her business' inventory. Because of this, she's seeking a new loan to buy bales of new and used clothing for both sexes (adults and children) to cover her customers' demand during this period of good sales.

Her earlier loan helped her to maintain continuous clothing sales. Her income is higher and her family's circumstances are changing positively.

loans.use: to buy bales of new and used clothing for both sexes (adults and children) to cover customer demand during a period of good sales.

loans.name: Dalila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dalila es una mujer de 47 años de edad que con mucho  esfuerzo y propio capital inicio un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación. Su mercadería asiste a las personas de su comunidad desde hace 5 años. Hoy en día, gracias a su empeño y buena administración posee una mayor variedad de productos. Con el propósito de  elevar sus ingresos y tener una venta más surtida  solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería como granos básicos, gaseosa, golosinas, etc.
Sus expectativas son crecer y fortalecer su producto, después de esto le gustaría dar a conocer su mercancía en todos los alrededores de su ciudad. De la misma manera Confiesa que el progreso en su negocio ha sido gracias a su familia, quienes la apoyan en toda circunstancia y contribuyen a que el sueño de Dalila de convertir su negocio en una gran miscelánea se vuelva realidad. El agradecimiento que ella siente por sus seres queridos es infinito.
texts.en: Dalila is a 47 year old woman who established a small business in her home with lots of work and her own capital. Her merchandise has been helping people from the community for five years. Currently, thanks to her efforts and good management she has a larger variety of products. She's applying for a loan to purchase merchandise such as staple foods, soft drinks, and sweets with the objective of having a better stocked business and boosting her income. Her expectations are to grow and improve her products, and afterwards she would like to promote her merchandise in every corner of the city. She also admits that she owes her business' progress to her family, who have supported her in every situation and help to make Dalila's dream of making her business a great grocery store come true. The gratitude that she feels towards her loved ones is infinite.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as staple foods, soft drinks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Sughraan

texts.en:
Sughraan is a 55-year-old, married woman. She is a very dedicated mother of 4 children. She has been running a business of making and selling woollen products such as hand-made sweaters, caps etc. She has been supporting her family with the help of income from this business.

She has requested for a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She wants to purchase spools of wool, yarns and needles for meeting customers' orders consistently to earn maximum profits for providing her children with the best education.

loans.use: to purchase spools of wool, yarns and needles for weaving to meet customers' orders consistently and earn maximum profits for providing her children with the best education.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 34-year-old, married woman. She has 4 children. 

Shamim is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good profit. This monetary help can take Shamim closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more embroidery materials to meet customers' orders.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown up children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 10 years now.

Nida is asking to take a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. With a loan, she will be able to raise healthy pigs which she can sell to the market after several weeks. 

In the future, Nida hopes of improving her hog raising business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a resident of Leyte, Philippines. She is 54 years old, married and has a 15 year old daughter. Elizabeth has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than 5 years now.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise. With a loan, Elizabeth will be able to improve her hog raising business thus allowing her to sell healthy pigs to the market after several weeks.

In the future, Elizabeth has hopes of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue. Moreover she wants to save money for the schooling of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items such as rice, pasta, coffee, rice noodles, beverages, and laundry soap, which she sells at retail. She expects a higher demand for grocery items this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and for a good return on her investment, which is a great help to cover their everyday needs and for her children's education. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Benita dreams of having a big grocery store someday. She aims to give her children the best education possible and to see them become professionals. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en:
Jovel lives in the town of Baybay, Leyte. She is a 22-year-old married woman with a two year old son. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for two years now, selling various items including noodles, canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and beverages. Her husband earns a living by working in construction.

Jovel is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase stocks of merchandise such as detergent, canned goods, condiments, spices, seasoning and toiletries. These items will help improve Jovel's store filled with stock. With these, she can attract more customers from her neighbourhood.

She is hoping that she can handle her current source of income profitably, so that she can send her son to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy detergent, canned goods, condiments, spices, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Ortukoy

texts.en:
Ortukoy was born in 1973. She is married and has 3 children. 

Ortukoy has been busy in animal husbandry for more than 18 years, and she has a lot of experience in this field. She sells milk in a local market and gets additional income from growing crops. The family's only source of income now is their agriculture business and so they live poorly. 

Ortukoy needs to repair the cowshed where she feeds her cattle. She is therefore asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials to repair a cowshed. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair a cowshed

loans.name: Jose Dionisio

texts.es:
José, está disponiendo todo para cultivar maicillo y necesita capital para invertirlo en semilla mejorada de maicillo, abono, insecticidas, etc.,  así dará un buen trato a su cultivo y lo protegerá de plagas. 
Todos los trabajos que implican la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos los pudo hacer en el tiempo justo gracias a la buena administración del préstamo anterior. Con las ganancias ha comprado cerdos y caballos para ir fortaleciendo el negocio. Su familia está en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
José is laying out everything to cultivate sorghum and needs capital to invest in an improved sorghum seed, manure, insecticides, etc. This way, he can treat his crops well and protect them from pests. 

Thanks to good management of the prior loan, he was able to complete all of the jobs that are involved in the harvesting of basic grains just in time. With the earnings, he has purchased pigs and horses to strengthen his business. His family is in optimal conditions.

loans.use: to protect and develop his crops by investing in an improved sorghum seed, manure, insecticides, etc. This will allow him to treat his crops well and protect them from pests.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy, age 50, dries and sells fish to earn an income. She has been engaged in this work for two decades. In the Philippines, salted and dried fish is a very popular breakfast choice, so her business is successful. She supplements her wares by buying additional dried fish from other vendors to offer for sale.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fresh fish to salt and dry, as well as to purchase more dried fish from other suppliers. She will also buy a new weighing scale. 

She is hopeful that this loan will enable her to continue sending her children to school. 

In the future, Medy hopes to explore other business options so that she can offer her children a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, dried fish, and a new weighing scale.

loans.name: Patu

texts.en:
Patu is a hardworking 40-year-old Ugandan man who is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Patu has repaid his previous loan which he used to buy salt, sugar, and soap to sell in his store. 

Despite the challenges of competition and price fluctuations, he hopes to grow and expand his business which will enable him to fulfill his primary wish of educating his children  

Patu is now requesting a loan to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Gerna

texts.en:
At 56 years old, Gerna is engaged in multiple businesses. She operates a sari-sari store, rents out a tractor, and operates a rice thresher. This business started in 2009. All her children are grown, and she works hard so that she will not be dependent on them.

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy an engine for the hand tractor, an arrow wheel for the rice thresher, canned goods, candies, noodles, seasoning, and toiletries.

Gerna is confident of the impact of her loan. It will definitely go a long way and help boost her business income. In the future, she hopes to save and make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the hand tractor, an arrow wheel for the rice thresher, canned goods, candies, noodles, seasoning, and toiletries.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John se dedica a la actividad de la confección desde hace aproximadamente 7años, gracias a esto ha podido contribuir, junto con su esposa al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. 
John es padre de 3 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer todo lo necesario, John decidió montar un taller donde ofrece el servicio de bordados en tela.
Gracias a la buena calidad de los trabajos que realiza, ha podido captar una muy buena clientela, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. 
John actualmente quiere aumentar la capacidad de producción de su taller con el ánimo de poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos como tela para aumentar su inventario y tener material disponible para trabajar.
John espera que de esta manera pueda cumplir su sueño de que sus hijos accedan a una educación universitaria, además, de poder mejorarle la calidad de vida a su familia. 
John espera que su taller aumente las ventas considerablemente y en un futuro hacerlo crecer y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Ayuda con un préstamo el taller de John!
texts.en:
John has been sewing for approximately 7 years. Thanks to this work, he has been able to contribute to the household expenses along with his wife.

John is a father of three children, and he has always wanted to offer them everything they need. John decided to open his own workshop, where he offers his services embroidering fabric.

Thanks to the good quality of his work, he has been able to attract a very good clientele, which has allowed him to have very good sales. John would like to increase his workshop's capacity for production, with the goal of being able to pay for his children's university studies. Therefore, he hopes that a loan will offer him the opportunity to buy supplies, such as fabric, to increase his inventory and to have available working materials.

John hopes that in this way, he will be able to accomplish his dream of his children gaining access to a university education. He also hopes to improve his family's quality of life. John hopes that his workshop's sales will increase considerably, and that in the future he will be able to grow his workshop and generate employment for the most needy people.

Help John's workshop with a loan!

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fabric, to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es:
Sandra de 24 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 
Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 
Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vida sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sandra, 24, has earned the affection of all of her neighbors for her friendliness and good sense of humor. She loves her family, which is her main motivation to fight every day and earn a livelihood to survive. Although she did not have the resources to start her business, this was not an obstacle for her to accomplish her goal of becoming a businesswoman. With a little capital, she started her business, which is a grocery store.

Her dreams do not stop, which is why she is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of shelves to place her products and make them more visible and attractive to her clients. She will also buy a variety of basic products to stock her business.

She hopes to improve her financial conditions and to be able to have a life without financial concerns, guaranteeing a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shelves to place her products.

loans.name: Viviana Maritza

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer de 37 años de edad, que desde hace 13 años comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.

Este negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a su esposo y a su hija no les haga falta nada.

El crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Viviana, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Viviana, aged 37, began working different jobs 13 years ago. At the moment she has a grocery store that a family member left to her to manage and generate income, so as to cover her household expenses.

She works in the store daily from 7am till 8pm and has managed to get good results, in spite of the competition that exists in the sector, so that her husband and daughter have not had to dispense with anything.

The loan she is asking for will be used towards stocking her shop at whole sale with products such as snacks, milk products, cookies and grains among others. Thus, allowing her to offer a larger variety to satisfy the immediate demand of her customers and consequentially increasing her sales and the income she receives for her work.

Viviana, with her fighting spirit and ambition to move ahead with her family, therefore continues to fight and move ahead to fulfill her dream of buying a house. There she could enjoy a better quality of life, accompanied by her family and offer a good education to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale, such as snacks, milk products, cookies and grains among others.

loans.name: Omer

texts.en:
Omer is a 52-year-old married man and a father of seven children, living with his father in the city of Sana'a, Yemen. He has a secondary school education. 

Omer lives with his family in a small, old house which is not enough for all the members of the family. In order to expand his house more, Omer decided to build extra rooms and renovate the other rooms of the house. Omer doesn't have enough money to fund the necessary expansion of the house. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy construction supplies to expand the house to provide adequate space for all members of the family.

Omer hopes to make a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to expand the house, ensuring adequate space for all members of the family.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.en:
Nazir is a 57 year old, married woman running a business selling milk. She has been selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

Nazir has 4 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income and provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income and provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es:
José, de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está felizmente casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, fruto de la relación tienen 4 hijos, los cuales viven con ellos y su hija mayor trabaja en un restaurante de comida rápida, colaborando así con los gastos familiares.

Desde los 12 años de edad José, aprendió a trabajar junto con a su padre en una finca, ahí estuvo hasta los 16 años, hasta que el ejército lo reclutó por obligación, en 1992 cuando terminó el conflicto armado, José, regresó a su vida como civil, trabajando como auxiliar de albañil, con el tiempo aprendió el oficio de estructuras metálicas y tiene 14 años dedicándose a éste trabajo, de forma independiente.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar madera y pagar la mano de obra, para la reparación del techo de su vivienda, pues actualmente la madera que tiene el techo, se encuentra en muy mal estado y necesita repararlo.
 
José, sueña con llegar a tener su propio taller de estructuras metálicas, pero también, desea remodelar su vivienda, de manera que exista un espacio seguro en donde pueda colocar todo el equipo y las herramientas necesarias.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old and studied through the sixth grade. He is happily married and his wife takes care of the household chores. They have 4 children who live with them, his oldest daughter works in a fast food restaurant and that way helps with the family expenses. When he turned 12 years old, José learned how to work with his father in a farm. He worked there until he was 16 years old when he was drafted by the military. In 1992 at the end of the armed conflict, José returned to his civil life working as an assistant bricklayer. With time he learned the trade of metal work and has been working on his own for 14 years.

The loan he requests is to buy wood and to pay for the labor to repair the roof of his house.  Currently the wood that is on the roof is in very bad condition and need repairs. José dreams of having his own metal shop and would also like to remodel his house in order to have a safe place to keep all the necessary equipment and tools.

loans.use: to buy wood and pay for the labor to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Romeo Antonio

texts.es:
Romeo, de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, debido a la situación económica de su familia, no pudo continuar y tuvo que abandonar sus estudios, para poder ayudar a su padre con los trabajos agrícolas, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos de las edades de 17 y 22 años, ambos  estudian. 

Romeo, es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años.- Antes de dedicarse a este negocio, se dedicaba a la venta de verduras, pero decidió optar por vender ropa, porque cuando no vendía la verdura, se le dañaba y esto le generaba demasiadas pérdidas.

Romeo, sale a vender la ropa, casa por casa y lo hace dos veces a la semana, suficiente para obtener buenas ganancias,  él no tiene lugares definidos para vender, ni horarios de trabajo establecidos, debido que es un negocio ambulante. 

Romeo, utilizará el crédito para comprar media docena de camisas, una docena de ropa interior para dama y caballero y una docena de sandalias, todo esto para aprovechar la temporada navideña, en la cual existe mucha demanda de estas prendas y se venden a buen precio.

Los planes de Romeo, es tener una boutique, donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes, diferentes tipos de prendas de marca y de moda.- También, planea construir su propia casa para que su familia viva mejor y cómodamente.
texts.en:
Romeo is 31 years old. Due to his family's financial situation, he wasn't able to stay in school and has a fourth grade education. He had to drop out in order to help his father in the fields. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have two children who are ages 17 and 22 and are both in school. 

Romeo works as a salesman. He has been selling clothing for the past two years. Before going into this business, he used to work selling vegetables, but he decided to switch to clothing because when he wasn't able to sell all of his vegetables they would go bad and he suffered too many losses. Now he goes out to sell his clothing items door-to-door. He does this twice a week, which is enough to make a good income. He doesn't have a particular area to cover or a set work schedule, because he works as a street vendor.

Romeo will use this loan to buy half a dozen shirts, a dozen of men and women's underwear, and a dozen pairs of sandals. All of this will help him make the most of the Christmas season, during which there is high demand for these items and they sell at a good price.

Romeo's plans include having a boutique one day, where he could offer his customers different styles and brands of clothing. He also plans to build a house for his family to live better and more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy shirts, underwear, and sandals to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 47 year old, married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Naseem makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make more stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Naseem wishes to utilize part of her revenues for providing a good quality of life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make more stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attracted a good number of customers and makes enough income to contribute to supporting her family. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 8th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, lace, ribbons, and packs of needles. This will enable her to stitch more dresses and generate more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, lace, ribbons, and packs of needles to stitch dresses to generate more profits.

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Nhanh makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In his group's village there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these members not only safeguard the health of their families. They will also save both money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time needed for collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild the duck farms as well as buy high quality feed.

loans.name: Saphy

texts.en: A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Saphy is 38 years old and the mother of four children. For her family condition, she grows rice and cassava as her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 20,100 KHR per day. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep for the new barn she would like to build

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 55-year-old married mother of eight children who has worked as a tailor for ten years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Fatima is an ambitious woman and hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, so today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy special textiles to tailor fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers during this winter season.

Fatima hopes to open her own tailoring shop in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy special textiles to tailor fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers during this winter season

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her late 30s, is married with three kids. Two of them are still in school and one is still small. She has been running two projects, an electronic money transfer business and a grocery store, for four years now.  She works from 7:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be one of Catherine's many loans from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the electronic money transfer business and started a grocery store.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more electronic money transfers and to restock the missing items in the grocery store. She dreams of owning other types of money transfers.

Catherine will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy more electronic money transfers and to restock the missing items in the grocery store

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 57 years old and a widow. She is a hardworhing mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, Florida applied for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Hearing of all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one. Florida has asked for a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more kilos of fish for retail.  She makes use of tiered foam in her fish vending and hopes to buy new foam as well. Through this project, she believes she will be able to raise more income, which will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fish for retail

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Alvin is a married man with a one-year-old son. He and his family live in Albuera, Leyte. 

For two years now, Alvin has been engaged in selling pork and chicken barbecue. Since the peak time to sell is mostly in the evening, Alvin would like to increase his production. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more chicken to cook and sell. He works hard so that he can save for his son’s future. 

Any profit will be for family daily consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business. Alvin hopes to expand his business in the future and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en:
Madilyn is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 14 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Madilyn is asking to take a loan to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets. With a loan, Madilyn and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Madilyn hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Pedro Jaime

texts.es:
Pedro es un humilde trabajador residente en el municipio de Medellín con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Es padre de 5 hijos por los cuales siempre tuvo el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.
Hoy en día se gana la vida con la venta de alimentos como frituras, golosinas y productos como cigarrillos, estos alimentos los transporta en una carretilla y los vende de manera ambulante.

De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son las fuertes lluvias y el alto costo de los insumos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido para mejorar y aumentar su inventario en esta temporada de fin de año, así podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a poor working-man who lives in the county of Medellin, and his life is full of dreams, hopes and the best wishes for his family. 

He's a father of five children and for their sake he has always shown courage and responsibility caring for them so that they can have the best life. Currently he makes a living selling foods such as fried snacks, sweets, and products like cigarettes. He transports these foods in a cart and sells them as a street vendor.

Heavy rain and the high cost of supplies are the hardest things he has to face in his job.

He's requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to expand and improve his inventory as the year comes to an end, so that he'll have enough income to continue with his business and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of foods such as fried snacks, sweets, and products like cigarettes.

loans.name: Sorangel

texts.es:
Sorangel, con 56 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Medellin; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una vitrina y comprará surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

Sorangel manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Sorangel, age 56, has been selling groceries in a store in the Medellin municipality for many years.  This way she complements the income with which she has gotten her children ahead.

Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to struggle tirelessly, always looking for the way to get ahead.  This drives her to request the loan to buy a display case and to buy stock wholesale (pastries, soft drinks, candy, and baked goods, among others).  This will allow her to continue with her work, and she will have a greater variety of items to offer her customers.  This way she will be improving sales and income.

Sorangel says that her greatest desire is to be able to get her own place to set up her business in the center of the city.  She wants it to be much more profitable and guarantee her favorable financial stability in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

She relies on the support from Interactuar and the Kiva lenders to achieve this objective.

loans.use: to buy a display case and to buy stock wholesale (pastries, soft drinks, candy, and baked goods, among others).

loans.name: Luz Nohelia

texts.es:
Luz se dedica a la actividad de la confección desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, gracias a esto ha podido contribuir, junto con su esposo al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. 

Luz es madre de 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer todo lo necesario, debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener su hogar, Luz decidió montar un taller donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros.  

Gracias a la buena calidad de las prendas que fabrica, ha podido captar una muy buena clientela, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. 

Luz actualmente quiere aumentar la capacidad de producción de su taller con el ánimo de poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos como tela, hilos y agujas.

Luz espera que de esta manera pueda cumplir su sueño de que sus hijos accedan a una educación universitaria, además, de poder mejorarle la calidad de vida a su familia. 

Luz espera que su taller aumente las ventas considerablemente y en un futuro hacerlo crecer y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Ayuda con un préstamo el taller de Luz!
texts.en:
Luz has made her living making dresses for about four years, which has allowed her to contribute, asking with her husband, to supporting household expenses.

Luz is the mother of two children, and she has always wanted to provide for them what they need. Because her husband's salary was not enough to be able to sustain their household, Luz decided to open a studio where she can offer her dressmaking services to third parties.

Thanks to the good quality of the garments she makes, she has been able to gather a large clientele, which has allowed her to make good sales.

Luz wants to increase her studio's capacity of production, with the aim of paying for her children's schooling. It's for this that she hopes the loan will give her the opportunity to buy supplies such as fabric, threads, and needles.

Luz hopes that this will fulfill her dream that her children will be able to access a university education and thus be able to improve the quality of life for their family.

Luz hopes that her studio will increase in sales considerably, and that in the future it will grow and be able to provide employment for those who need it.

Help with a loan for Luz's studio!

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, threads, and needles

loans.name: Javier Enrique

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 23 años de edad, que desde hace 1 año comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.

Este negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a su esposa y a sus hijas no les haga falta nada.

El crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Javier, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Javier is 23 years old and started working different jobs one year ago. Currently he has a grocery store that was transferred to him by a relative so that he could work and generate an income to support his household. He tends to his business every day from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm and, in spite of the existing competition in the neighborhood, he has obtained good results and made enough income for his wife and daughters not to want for anything.

He will use the loan he is requesting from Corporación Interactuar to stock up on wholesale products like snacks, dairy products, pastries, grains, and other items. This will allow him to offer a wider variety of products to meet his customers' immediate needs and, in turn, to increase sales and the income he earns from his work.

Javier is driven to improve himself and get ahead with his family. They are his motivation to keep working hard and moving forward in order to achieve his dreams of buying a home where he and his family could enjoy a better quality of life and giving his daughters a good education.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise like snacks, dairy products, pastries, and grains.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Dora es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
Ella prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima como pan, queso, carnes frías, entre otros, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en: Thanks to Dora's perseverance and courage her home can live a life with dignity. She prepares and sells fast food in the Medellin municipality, a profession she learned with the goal of seeking new income to support her family. Her husband and children are her daily motivation and strengthen her every day. She hopes to be able to move her business forward by using the loan to buy supplies and ingredients such as bread, cheese, cold meats, and other items. This support will come from Interactuar and the Kiva lenders. With these items she will be able to have her food available to customers at all times. Her greatest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same area in order to not lose customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients such as bread, cheese, cold meats, and other items.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en: Akhtar has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attracted a good number of customers and makes enough income to contribute to supporting her family. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her milk sales and gain more profits.

loans.name: Maria Nelza

texts.es:
Maria tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su tres hijos en casa propia de material rústico en una comunidad pequeña del distrito Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza María es la cría y comercialización de animales menores como patos, gallinas y cuyes, los mismos que cría en un corral ubicado en su domicilio, se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años y adicionalmente hace 5 años cultiva maíz. Cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro y con clientes fijos que brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del crédito será para compra de gallinas y patos para aumentar el stock de su negocio así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde cría a sus animales, con ello Maria espera poder diversificar su stock de animales, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar sus ganancias así como su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María, 35, is a single mother.  She lives with her three children in her own house made of rustic material in a small community in the Santo Tomás district of the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.  The residents of this district work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

María's job is raising and selling small animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs.  She raises them in a corral located at her home.  She has earned a living in this line of work for ten years, and she has also grown corn for five years.  She has a lot of experience in this area and steady customers who give her very good personal and professional references.

The loan will be to buy chickens and ducks to increase her stock in her business, as well as to make repairs on the place where she raises her animals.

María hopes this will help her diversify her animal stock, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her profits as well as her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks to expand her business and to make repairs on the place she raises her animals

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita lives in Albuera, Leyte. At 51 years old, she is good with direct selling of beauty products and household consumables. For five years now, she has been selling products from Personal Collection such as body spray, facial cleanser, deodorant, fabric conditioner, hand and body lotion and toilet cleaner. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy cologne, hand and body lotion and fabric conditioner.

Any income from this business will help supplement the income from her husband, who works as a carpenter. It will help buy food and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy cologne, hand and body lotion and fabric conditioner for resale

loans.name: Vipaji Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her mid-30,s, is single with one child who is still in school. She has been selling fish for three years now. She works from 5 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Josephine's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the fish stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy fish and meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of increasing her fish business.

Josephine will share this loan with her loan group "Vipaji Group" which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Miralona

texts.en:
Miralona is a rice retailer from Iloilo, Philippines. She is 59 years old,a married woman and a mother of six grown-up children. Miralona has been in the business for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income. 
Miralona is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more her customers. In the future, Miralona hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is from Baybay, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari store business where she sells items like biscuits, soft drinks, spices, detergent soap and vegetables. She also raises hogs for a living. Luzviminda earns about 7,000 PHP per month with her store. Luzviminda has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy vegetables and feed and to pay for the repair of her store. By expanding her store, Luzviminda hopes for her family to experience a progressive life.

She will continue to work hard so that her business will prosper and help support her two children, ages seven and eighteen.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and feed and to pay for the repair of her store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane earns a living through her sari-sari (variety) store business in her area of Baybay, Leyte. In her store, she sell items like candies, canned goods, condiments, shampoo, bath soap, sugar, diapers, milk and soft drinks. She usually earns 6,000 per month. 

Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

Mary Jane is 40 years old with children aged 17 and 19. She dreams of living a life of abundance through the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: La Calera Group

texts.es:
Doña Eulalia tiene 44 años de edad y está casada con el señor Eulalio desde hace 23 años, juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia su educación secundaria, los demás ya son independientes. 

Eulalia se dedica a la cría y engorda de borregos desde hace 5 años. “Cuando se es madre tenemos la obligación de darles lo mejor a nuestros hijos por eso mismo yo decidí iniciar mi propio negocio”. En un principio, Eulalia solicitó tres mil pesos (USD$ 206) a otra financiera, dinero que utilizó para comprar tres borreguitos, con el tiempo el número de animales ha ido en aumento. Ahora, está planeando comprar siete borreguitos pequeños; normalmente los conserva durante todo un año para poder venderlos ya que han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso. Doña Eulalia les dedica más de cinco horas al día, en las mañanas los lleva al comedero, pero en las tardes debe sacarlos a pastar al campo. Los mejores clientes son personas que se dedican a preparar la carne para vender un platillo tradicional de la región llamado "barbacoa". Eulalia está muy contenta con sus animalitos aunque ahora habrá más trabajo porque tendrá once; afortunadamente, cuando llegan a enfermar, ella misma los inyecta, su hijo que es veterinario fue quien le enseñó a hacerlo. 

La meta de Doña Eulalia es poder seguir aumentando el número de sus borregos aunque su mayor anhelo es que su hijo menor termine una carrera profesional. “Yo no estudié y aunque quisiera encontrar un trabajo mejor, no puedo porque no tengo los conocimientos suficientes y no me gustaría que mi hijo pasara por lo mismo” comentó Doña Eulalia. En la comunidad donde viven los integrantes del grupo por lo regular los jóvenes solo terminan la secundaria, pero los padres siempre tratan de esforzarse y convencerlos de que continúen preparándose. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Juana M., Maria del Carmen, Patricia, Vicenta, Maricela, Juana S., Susana y Gregorio quienes también solicitaron un préstamo para invertirlo en su actividad que es la misma que doña Eulalia.

*La foto fue tomada en las escaleras del quisoco del Municipio, Doña Eulalia es quien tiene el suéter en color morado. Algunas de las integrantes muestran los bordados que elaboran ellas mismas para después venderlas y obtener un ingreso extra.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 44 years old and has been married to her husband Eulalio for 23 years. Together, they have formed a family with their four children. One son is in middle school. The others are independent.

Eulalia has bred and fattened sheep for 5 years. “We as mothers have an obligation to give our children the best. For this reason, I decided to start my own business.” Initially, Eulalia requested 3 thousand pesos (USD $206) from another financial organization. She used this loan to buy three lambs. Over time, the number of animals she has has increased. Now, she is planning to buy seven small lambs that she normally raises for a year and sells after they reach a good size and weight. Eulalia works with her lambs more than 5 hours a day. In the morning, she leads them to their feed but she lets them out to graze in the evenings. Her best customers are people who prepare meat to sell a traditional dish of the region called barbacoa [barbeque]. Eulalia is very happy with her animals but now there will be more work with 11 lambs. Fortunately, when they get sick she can give them injections because her son who is a vet taught her how to do so.

Eulalia’s goal is to continue increasing the number of sheep although her greater wish is that her youngest child completes his studies. “I did not study and if I wanted to find a better job I cannot because I do not have enough knowledge. I do not want my son to go through the same,” said Eulalia. In the community where the group members live, usually only young people finish middle school but parents try to convince them continue studying. 

The other members of this group are Juana M, Maria del Carmen, Patricia, Vicenta, Maricela, Juana S., Susana, and Gregorio who also applied for a loan to invest in their economic activities similar to Eulalia.

*The photo was taken on the Steps of Quisoco in their municipality. Eulalia has a purple sweater. Some of the members show the embroideries that they make and sell themselves for extra income.

loans.use: to purchase seven lambs

location.town: San Juan Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor lives in Iloilo, Philippines and is the 50-year-old married mother of 10 children. She is engaged in retail sales of farm products at the local market. Her husband is a farmer.

Eleanor is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides for their farm. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve the productivity of their farm and thus augment their harvest and profit.

In the future, Eleanor hopes to make their farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is thankful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy chicken feed for her second business which is poultry. She will also use part of the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for a good harvest on her farm. She thanks God and you in advance for a good return on her two businesses and the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas! 

Aurora dreams for her farm and poultry business to prosper. She prays for good health, happy and quiet life. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work, and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for chicken feed needed in her poultry business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 27-year-old hardworking man living with two children in Kagadi, Uganda. He trades in cattle and does welding to generate income. He hopes to grow his business though challenged by constant load shading (electricity cut-offs) affecting his welding works. John is asking for a loan to buy metals for making doors and windows to sell.

loans.use: to buy metals for making doors and windows to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is grateful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is, through her earnings, able to cover and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, pasta, coffee, rice noodles, frozen foods and beverages which she sells at retail. She expects a higher demand of grocery items now that Christmas is just around the corner. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She is wishing everyone a Blessed Christmas!
