Gloria plans to have a big grocery store someday. She dreams of a more prosperous life. She also prays for a happy and quiet life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to resell at her store.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
The members of Phan’s group live in a rural village in the province of Battambang. Phan works as farmer to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, age 34, grows rice and raises pigs to earn her living. She is the mother of three children, all enrolled in school, and lives in the province of Kampong Chan.

This will be Sophy's second loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has fully repaid her previous loan. She will use her loan funds to buy piglets to raise.

Her goal is to earn a better income so that she can raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Channra's Group

texts.en:
Channra’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Channra works as farmer to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chreb makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Kay's Group

texts.en:
The members of Kay’s group live in a rural village in the province of Kompong Thom. Kay supports her family by cultivating rice, and she supplements her income by doing extra farming work elsewhere. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Long’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Long makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and by selling groceries to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Thoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Thoeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Noeun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Noeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Han’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Han makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of this woman and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hon's Group

texts.en:
The members of Hon’s group live in a rural village in the province of Kompong Thom. Hon cultivates rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man with three children living with his family in his own house in Sana'a city, Yemen. He had studied until the secondary school, but couldn't continue because he needed to any work to cover his life's needs. Ali works as an employee with a very small salary, so he decided to buy a taxi and work in it as a driver. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do. As a result, he came to ask a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a taxi to work in it as a driver and gain more income to help him cover the needs of his family. 
Ali hopes to have many taxis and to rent them with a monthly rate.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Elkin De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Elkin es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. 

Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para surtir su almacén con gran cantidad de repuestos, de este modo podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elkin is a very experienced auto mechanic.  He has acquired many skills through small studies at different academies.  The other part he has learned empirically.  In addition to his work as a mechanic, he also has a small shop where he sells automotive replacement parts.  He sells different types and different brands of replacement parts.

He is a very hard-working and honorable man who knows how important automobiles are to their owners.  That is why he always tries to provide excellent, good quality service in an efficient manner.

He is requesting a loan to stock his shop with a great quantity of replacement parts.  This way he will be able to have the products available for his customers.

loans.use: to stock his shop with a great quantity of automotive replacement parts.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
En la electrónica encuentran muchas personas una oportunidad para progresar y salir delante de una manera humilde y con mucho coraje, tal es el caso de Luis que a sus 63 años es un hombre con gran talento y pasión por este oficio.
Realiza varios trabajos de reparación y mantenimiento de productos y elementos electrónicos.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de un compresor, el cual le permitirá continuar con su trabajo con el cual ha intentado obtener algunos ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y aportar con la economía de su hogar.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de oportunidades para crecer y desarrollarse como técnico, pero poco a poco intentara tener una vida mejor.

Apoya a Luis con su oficio y haz que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Working in electronics there are many people who have the opportunity to progress and get ahead in a humble and courageous manner, and this is the case of 63 year old Luis who is a man with a great talent and passion for this work. He does repairs and maintenance on electronic elements and products. He seeks a loan to buy a compressor, which will enable him to continue with his work which provides him income so he can support his children and household. One of the great difficulties that he has had to confront is the lack of opportunities to grow and develop his technical skill, but little by little he intends to have a better life.

Support Luis with his work and make his life better with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johana es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 25 años de edad, es casada y madre de 1 hija a la que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 1 año se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió a través de clases y trabaja todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una maquina recubridora que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de producción para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes actuales.

Johana manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Johana is a vigorous, helpful, and hardworking woman. She is 25 years old, married, and has a daughter whom she is raising with all her effort and dedication. For the past year, she has been working as a seamstress, offering her sewing services to third parties as well as direct customers. She learned the trade by taking classes and works every day. This allows her to generate enough financial resources to help her husband support their household.

She currently decided to request a loan in order to purchase an overstitch sewing machine, which will allow her to increase her production level and fill pending orders on time. This in turn will help her earn her current customers' loyalty.

Johana states she wants to keep working hard because she wants to expand her business and one day be able to create job opportunities as well as secure financial stability for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en: Khouloud is a 28-year-old married mother of one child. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her child's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Khouloud hopes to stay capable of providing her child with the necessary living needs, and developing her social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 51-year-old married father of four children. He is acquiring this loan to pay for his children's school tuition fees. 

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. 

Mohammad hopes to stay capable of providing his children with the necessary living needs and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with two children, ages seven and nine. Two years ago, Gemma started a business as a feed retailer. She sell Pigrolac feed to hog raisers for an income. Pigrolac has been a very well-known brand that provides good nutrition and is known to help fatten hogs.

Her business is thriving and she is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy more sacks of feed to resell. Her profit will definitely help her husband, who is a construction worker.

In the future, Gemma would like to become a wholesaler of feed to increase business profitability.

loans.use: to buy sacks of Pigrolac feed.

loans.name: Antero

texts.en:
Antero is a 60-year-old married man living in Leyte, Philippines. He runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in his locality. 

Antero has been in the business for more than 30 years now. Antero is asking to take a loan to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, snack foods, and other items. 

This loan will help him improve his stocks, thus attracting more buyers in his store. In the future, Antero hopes to expand his business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, snack foods, and others goods

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that, through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like pasta, coffee, beverages and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. She expects a higher demand for groceries now that Christmas is just around the corner. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.

Marivic dreams of having a big grocery store and aims to give her children the best education and to see them become professionals. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is a 55-year-old married woman with five adult children. Her husband is a farmer, while Marlina works hard raising hogs and on dairy production through milking of carabao (water buffalo). She started her business five years ago, and it earns her an average income of 5,000 PHP per month. She is asking a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements for her hogs.

Marlina can only rely on the impact of loans. She hope that this will increase her business profits and will allow her to cultivate a vegetable farm someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is thankful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that, through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. She was also able to start selling vegetables in their area.

She would now like to apply for a 51,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, pasta, soda, rice noodles and processed meat which she sells at retail. Part of the loan she will use to buy different kinds of vegetables from a wholesaler's farm to sell. She expects a much higher demand for grocery items and vegetables this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. 

Mercidita dreams of having a big grocery store someday to serve more customers. She aims to give her children the best education possible in order for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale such as blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, perfume, and other other items.

loans.name: Imena Group

texts.en: Imena is a group led by Jacqueline who is 26 years old. The group name means “important person” in English. She has been a group leader for six years. She has a shop and has been in a business for 19 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and rice for resale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his sewing workshop

loans.name: Carmen Ileana

texts.en:
Carmen is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She owns a business in which she rents clothes for special occasions such as parties, graduations, etc. 

She is asking for a loan to produce more clothing to rent. She has many clients and this is a time of year of high demand. She started the business because her father was a tailor and she decided to buy clothes from him and rent them to other people. Now she has different varieties and sizes which helps her to attend to many different clients.

Her biggest achievement is starting and maintaining a business; her goal is to make it grow.

loans.use: To acquire suits and tuxedos to rent.

loans.name: Walter Jenrry

texts.es:
Walter Jenrry tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se desempeña brindando servicio de transporte de materiales de construcción como motocargista, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia brindando este servicio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su moto carguera (vehículo) que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, esta inversión le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá aumentar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter Jenrry is 56 years old and married.  He lives with his family in a rural area in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The population in this district works in commerce, in agriculture, and with livestock as their main business activities.

He works by transporting construction materials as a ‘motocargista’ [using three wheeled motorized vehicle to transport cargo].  He has over five years of experience providing this service, and he has very good personal and work references in the area.

The current loan will be used to make repairs and perform maintenance on the vehicle he uses to transport cargo.  It is currently in bad shape, and this investment will allow him to provide better service to his customers.  This will allow him to increase his income level and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and perform maintenance on the vehicle he uses to transport cargo.

loans.name: Marlin Adali

texts.es:
Marlin, de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta 7º grado, es madre soltera de dos hijos.

Marlin, hace tamales para vender, pero solo los hace por encargo; toda su familia se dedica a este negocio ysu 
hermana le ayuda, en ir a vender los tamales casa por casa.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar platos descartables, frijoles, plátanos, entre otros insumos, para iniciar a vender cenas típicas en su casa.- Para obtener ingresos adicionales a los que deja la venta de tamales y de esa forma logrará salir adelante para crecer a sus hijos.

Marlin, sueña con mantener siempre su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos para que continúen estudiando
texts.en:
Marlin is 25 years old. She studied through 7th grade, and she is a single mother of two children. Marlin makes tamales for sale, but she only makes them to order. Her entire family works at this business. Her sister helps her sell the tamales door-to-door.

She is requesting a loan to buy disposable plates, beans, and plantains, among other supplies, in order to start selling typical dinners at her home. She hopes to obtain an additional income to what she earns selling tamales so that she can move forward and raise her children. Marlin dreams of always having her business so that she can help her children continue studying.

loans.use: to buy disposable plates, beans, and plantains, among other supplies, in order to start selling typical dinners at her home.

loans.name: Juan Mauricio

texts.es:
Juan, de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a la venta de tortillas, tienen dos hijos pequeños, viven en casa familiar.

Juan, desde hace mucho tiempo, se dedica a hacer viajes a varias partes de la ciudad, lo realiza todos los días de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo lo utilizará específicamente para comprar medicinas a su hija, ya que son demasiado caras y con lo que gana no le ajusta para comprarlas; de esta forma se le ayudará para que su hija se recupere y tenga buena salud.

Juan, sueña con comprar un nuevo vehículo y además, desea superarse, ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, age 33, went to school through the sixth grade.  He is married, and his wife does the household chores and sells tortillas.  They have two small children, and they live in the family house.

Juan has been making trips to various parts of the city for a long time.  He does this every day from Monday through Saturday.

He will use the loan specifically to buy medicines for his daughter.  They are too expensive, and he does not earn enough to buy them.  This will help his daughter recuperate and have good health.

Juan dreams of buying a new vehicle.  Also, he wishes to improve himself, for his children to go to school, and to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy medication for his daughter.

loans.name: Soaphorn's Group

texts.en:
Residing living in Kampong Cham province, Soaphorn is 38 years old and a mother of two children. Nowadays she earns income to support her family condition via cassava growing. For Soaphorn, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. 

She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that she can gain more yield than before.

loans.use: To buy pesticide, fertilizer, and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker, age 30, makes and sells potato crisps to earn his living. He and his wife have two children, and the family lives in a rural area called Kiyanja.

Baker is a first-time borrower from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. He is requesting a loan in the amount of UGX 2,000,000 in order to buy Irish potatoes, cassava, and cooking oil for making crisps. This will replenish his stock in his crisps production business, which he operates at the market at Nabbingo, a busy trading center. He has a ready clientele, selling his wares to supermarkets and neighboring shops.

He is so grateful for the support given to him as a low-income earner, and his future plan is to expand his business by finding ways to add further value to his products.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cassava, and cooking oil for making crisps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manures and fertilizers for protecting her carrot crop.

loans.name: Non's Group

texts.en:
Non’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Non makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ro's Group

texts.en:
The members of Ro’s group live in a rural village in the province of Kompong Thom. Ro makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra farming work to further support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Sakun's Group

texts.en:
The members of Sakun’s group live in a rural village in the province of Kompong Thom. Sakun works as farmer, and she also works as teacher and as an officer to further support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
The members of Yen’s group live in a rural village in the province of Kompong Thom. Yen makes a living cultivating rice and planting cassava, and she also does extra farming work elsewhere to better support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en:
Motaz is a 23-year-old single man from Attell, a village near Tulkarem. He lives with his parents and four brothers and sisters. His father is a farmer with unstable income. Motaz opened a grocery store three years ago to help his father with the family expenses. His brothers sometimes help him. Motaz would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Motaz took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a refrigerator for his grocery store and also some grocery products. By taking this loan, Motaz will be able to increase the store's sales. 

Motaz appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for his grocery store and also some grocery products.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 43 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 18, 12, 10 y 4 años de edad en vivienda propia. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida con su trabajo como carpintero fabricando juegos de comedor desde hace 16 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia cuenta con toda la confianza de su jefe y sus clientes. Manuel desea reparar el techo de su vivienda y colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, clavos, ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y mano de obra para colocar ladrillo de piso y reparar el techo.
texts.en: Manuel is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his spouse and their 4 children, ages 18, 12, 10 and 4. He is a hardworking man who earns a living working as a carpenter. He has made dining sets for 16 years. Thanks to his experience, he has the confidence of his boss and his clients. Manuel wants to repair the roof of his house and put brick floor in his home. That is why he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in: galvanized sheets, nails, brick floor, cement, sand, and labor costs to install brick floor and repair the roof.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized sheets, nails, brick floor, cement, sand, and labor costs to install brick floor and repair the roof.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 41 years old. She is married with seven children between the ages of 13 and 29 years. All of her children go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for 10 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de alimentos como frituras y productos como cigarrillos y golosinas.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y su hijo quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Maria solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de surtido de estos elementos y así poder aumentar su inventario.

Con tu ayuda Maria Podrá pagar la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Maria is a very enterprising and tenacious woman with grand dreams that she has grown and tried to achieve.

She has a small business selling food, such as fritters, and products such as cigarettes and candies.

With this activity, day by day she intends to get ahead and improve her family’s living conditions. Her family is made up of her spouse and her son who drive her life and are her motivation to fight daily.

Her greatest difficulty is the sector’s competency, but with her great work capacity she is able to sustain herself and make progress.

Maria is requesting a loan to be able to buy supplies for these items and be able to increase her inventory.

With your help, Maria will be able to pay for her child’s education, which is one of her greatest dreams!

loans.use: to buy supplies for fritters and products such as cigarettes and candies.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario de 39 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos como: golosinas, bebidas frías y calientes, platillos típicos, etc. actividad que realiza en una chalet ubicado en zona de mucha afluencia de personas. Rosario desea instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, grava y arena para instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y de su familia.
texts.en: Rosario is 39 years old and lives in her own house together with her spouse and their 16-year-old son. She is an enterprising woman who makes a living selling products such as: candies, cold and hot drinks, traditional dishes, etc., an activity that she does in a chalet located in an area with a high flow of people. Rosario hopes to install brick floor in her home. For this, she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in: brick floor, cement, gravel, and sand to install brick floor in her home and in this way be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in: brick floor, cement, gravel, and sand to install brick floor in her home.

loans.name: Marseliana

texts.es:
Marseliana es una mujer  que trabaja con la mente puesta en un mejor futuro para su vida; es por ello que día con día se esfuerza para alcanzar sus metas; ella tiene 31 años y actualmente es soltera.

Ella ejerce una de las labores más importantes en cualquier sociedad, trabaja como maestra de educación primaria en la comunidad donde vive; ejerce la profesión que le gusta y además de ello le permite obtener un salario con el cual cubre sus necesidades básicas. Ella tiene más de 4 años educando a los niños. 

Además de la educación, ella también se dedica a la compraventa de ropa típica; con los ingresos que genera de esta actividad complementa su presupuesto de gastos.
 
Marseliana quiere  tener prosperidad, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa típica para ampliar su negocio.
 
Su mayor sueño es que su negocio en el futuro sea muy grande y que le genere más ingresos.
texts.en:
Marseliana is a woman who works with her mind on the future for her life. Because of this, she works day after day to achieve her goals. She is 31 years old and currently single.

She does one of the most important jobs in any society - she works as a primary school teacher in the community where she lives. She does the job she likes that also allows her to earn a good income which covers her basic necessities. She's been teaching children for more than four years.

In addition to education, she also earns a living buying and selling traditional clothing. The income she earns from this activity complements her spending budget.

Marseliana wants to have prosperity. Because of this, she's seeking a loan to buy traditional clothing to grow her business. Her biggest dream is that her business is very large and generates more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an umbrella and ingredients such as flour and meat.

loans.name: Jorge Albeiro

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre dedicado a su familia y a su labor. 

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 

Desde hace 30 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un local.

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposa con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su único hijo. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un tocador e insumos al por mayor como tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Jorge manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitivo en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a man dedicated to his family and to his work. His tenacity and perseverance have made it possible for him to get ahead, overcoming various obstacles along the way.

Thirty years ago, he started his own business when he setup a beauty salon. This has enabled him to generate enough income to support his wife with the household expenses, and provide all the necessities for his only son.

He is requesting this loan to invest in a dressing table and wholesale supplies such as hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, and nail polish among other things. This will allow him to continue with his work, and provide a more complete service to his customers. By providing his services in a more timely and efficient manner, his earnings will increase.

Jorge reveals that his greatest desire is to be able to continue with his work, and accredit and strengthen his business to be more competitive in the market. This will make it possible for him to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy a dressing table and wholesale supplies such as hair treatments.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 36 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of three and nine years, and all of them go to school. She has a restaurant and has been in business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans for making food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and beans for making food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, onions, etc so she can offer fresh merchandise.

loans.name: Phuy's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Phuy is 47 years old and the mother of one child. She struggles to alleviate her family’s hardship via rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 34,700 KHR per day.

This is the fifth cycle for Phuy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can continue to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: La Concepción Group

texts.es:
Doña Eva tiene 42 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, está casada con el señor Carlos desde hace 17 años y han formado una familia con tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando la universidad, la secundaria y la primaria, respectivamente. 

Desde que se casaron, Don Carlos y Doña Eva contaban ya con dos máquinas de coser pequeñas, en ese entonces solo se dedicaban a elaborar pants y playeras que solían vender en las calles, plazas y tianguis. Cierto día, una profesora los contrató para elaborar uniformes deportivos para los demás maestros de la escuela. Sonriendo, Doña Eva comentó “Para mí quedaron muy feos, pero a la maestra le gustó mucho nuestro trabajo y nos hizo un nuevo pedido”.

Poco a poco, el número de clientes creció, pero Doña Eva y Don Carlos sabían que la calidad de su trabajo debía mejorar, fue entonces cuando VisionFund les dio su primer préstamo para comprar una máquina industrial, terminaron de pagar el crédito, pero aún les hacía falta más maquinaria y continuaron solicitando el apoyo. En esta ocasión comprarán tela, hilos y cierres. Ellos están muy agradecidos con los préstamos otorgados porque han podido comprar máquinas y material lo cual les ha permitido seguir creciendo. Actualmente, la pareja elabora uniformes escolares, pants, pants, playeras, faldas, suéteres, etc. y ya tienen clientes seguros, personas que año tras año les hacen pedidos importantes para las escuelas. En las temporadas de agosto y septiembre el trabajo aumenta y es cuando Eva contrata a dos costureras más para que le ayuden en terminar sus pedidos ya que nunca le ha gustado quedar mal con sus clientes, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus entregas.

El sueño de Doña Eva es poner un taller de costura en el municipio, cree que si instala su taller podría aumentar sus ganancias y daría mas trabajo a otras mujeres. Sin embargo, su única dificultad es la falta de dinero para comparar más maquinas y emprender el negocio, mas no pierde las esperanzas de poder lograrlo.

Los integrantes del grupo son: Antonio quien invierte en su herrería, Juana, en borregos; Angélica, en la renta de un molino y Diana, en una pequeña tienda artesanal.

*La fotografía fue capturada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco del municipio. Doña Eva es la señora más sonriente, quien viste el suéter morado*
texts.en:
Eva is 42 years old. She is a very happy and hardworking woman. She has been married to Carlos for 17 years and they have created a family with three children who are studying in college, high school, and elementary school, respectively. 

When they got married, Carlos and Eva had two small sewing machines. Back then, they only made pants and t-shirts, which they would sell in the streets, plazas, and street markets. One day, a professor hired them to make sports uniforms for the rest of the teachers in the school. Smiling, Eva commented, “To me, they were really ugly, but the teacher liked our work a lot and she placed another order.”

Little by little, the number of customers grew, but Eva and Carlos knew that the quality of their work had to improve. That is when VisionFund gave them their first loan to buy an industrial machine. They paid back the loan, but they still needed more machinery and they continued requesting the support. This time, they will buy fabric, thread, and zippers. They are very thankful for the loans they have been given because they have been able to buy machines and materials that have allowed them to continue growing. 

Currently, the couple makes school uniforms, pants, t-shirts, skirts, sweaters, etc. They already have regular customers – people who, year after year, place important orders for the schools. In August and September, their work increases and this is when Eva hires two additional seamstresses to help with the orders. Since she has never liked to displease her customers, she has always been very punctual in her deliveries. 

Eva’s dream is to establish a sewing shop in the municipality. She believes that if she installs her workshop she will be able to increase her earnings and give more work to other women. Her one difficulty is the lack of money to buy more machines and launch the business, but she never loses hope in being able to succeed. 

The members of the group are: Antonio, who is investing in his blacksmith shop; Juana, who is investing in lambs; Angélica, who is investing in rent for a mill; and Diana, who is investing in a small artisanal shop. 

*The photograph was taken in the stairs underneath the municipality’s pavilion. Eva is the woman who is smiling the most, who is wearing a purple sweater.*

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Grace, a 58-year-old farmer from a remote village in Bonyamatuta in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She resides with her husband, with whom she is blessed with five children.

Grace has been actively involved in farming for the last 35 years and has never regretted it or looked back. She practices mixed farming, and sells milk, eggs and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy, and green grams (mung beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production, and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins.

Through her increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure, and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer.

Your loan will bring joy to this family because Grace will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Juana Marleni

texts.es:
Juana, considera que la buena administración del préstamo anterior le ha permitido tener la su salón de belleza bien equipado para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, las circunstancias familiares se mantienen y los ingresos están mejorando.
En estas fiestas navideñas requiere de un nuevo crédito para suplir las nuevas demandas que hacen sus clientes, comprara cremas corporales, tintes, labiales, rubores, y otros productos necesarios para el salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Juana believes her good handling of the previous loan allowed her to have her salon well-equipped to satisfy the demands of her clients, maintain her family circumstances, and improve her income.

During this Christmas holiday, she needs a new loan for supplies for the new demands her clients make. She will buy body creams, dyes, lipsticks, blushes, and other products needed for her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy body creams, dyes, lipsticks, blushes, and other products needed for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Benh's Group

texts.en: Benh’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Benh works as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Chanty's Group

texts.en:
Chanty’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chanty makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs, and she does extra work as a seller of groceries at home to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chhengky's Group

texts.en:
Chhengky’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chhengky makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Channy makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work selling groceries from home to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and this man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
The members of Saroeun's group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saroeun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work selling grocery items from his home to further support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowes to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family

loans.name: Ernesto Eliseo

texts.es:
Ernesto, se ha visto beneficiado con la ayuda que le da el Proyecto Kiva, a través del financiamiento anterior, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar cerdos pequeños, vacunas y alimento para los mismos, además invertirá en los costos de la recolección de la cosecha, esto es con el propósito de continuar fortaleciendo su negocio.
Anteriormente invirtió en insumos agrícolas para cultivar maíz y frijol, también pudo mejorar la crianza de cerdos, la vida familiar está cambiando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Ernesto has benefitted from the help that the Kiva Project gave him with previous financing. He is requesting a new loan to buy small pigs, as well as vaccines and food for them, and to invest in the costs of collecting his harvest. This will continue to strengthen his business.

Previously, Ernesto invested his agricultural supplies in cultivating corn and beans. He also improved raising pigs. His family life is changing little by little.

loans.use: to buy small pigs, as well as vaccines and food for them, and to invest in the costs of collecting his harvest.

loans.name: Dora Emely

texts.es:
Dora, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, no continúo sus estudios en la universidad debido a que salió embarazada y sus padres no le dieron el apoyo para continuar.- Está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura,  tienen dos hijos, de 8 y 4 años de edad.

Dora, se dedica a cuidar niños en una guardería desde hace cuatro años, ella disfruta mucho su trabajo, porque además ayuda a muchas personas que trabajan y no tienen quien les cuide a sus hijos, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes de 7:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.
 
El préstamo Dora, lo utilizará para comprar 500 bloques, 20 bolsas de cemento, 5 metros de arena y para pagar la mano de obra, todo esto para construir un cuarto y ampliar más su casa, con esta obra toda su familia estará y vivirán más cómodamente y mejorara su calidad de vida para el futuro.

Los planes de Dora, es poner un negocio en el cual pueda obtener ganancias seguras. Además, desea seguir ampliando su casa, para que sus hijos puedan tener sus propios cuartos y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien en el futuro.
texts.en:
Dora is 27 years old and has a high school education. She didn't go on to a university as she was pregnant and her parents didn't provide the support she needed to continue her studies. Dora is a married to farmer, and they have two children, ages eight and four. 

Dora has worked in a day care center for the past four years, working from 7:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. on weekdays. She enjoys her job very much because she likes helping people who work and need someone to care for their children. 

Dora will use this loan to purchase 500 cinder blocks, 20 bags of cement, 5 meters of sand, and to pay laborers who will expand her home by adding a room. This addition will provide greater comfort and a higher quality of life for Dora and her family.  

Dora plans to start her a business so that she can earn steady income. She also wants to continue expanding her house so that her children can have their own rooms. Dora also hopes that her children will continue to study and become upstanding people when they grow up.

loans.use: to purchase 500 cinder blocks, 20 bags of cement, 5 meters of sand, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de mercancía e insumos variados en su camión a través de las veredas del municipio de Norcasia posibilitando el abastecimiento de la comunidad en las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es casado y sostiene a su esposa a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su camión ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la integridad de sus cargas.

Apoya a Fernando con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Fernando is a very hardworking and organized man. He makes a living offering services transporting various merchandise and supplies in his truck through the sidewalks in the Norcasia municipality. This makes it possible to supply the communities in various areas of the municipality.

Fernando is a friendly, helpful, and very enterprising man. He is married and supports his wife, for whom he has always managed to offer the best life possible.

Fernando is requesting a loan to maintain and repair his truck since it is his only means of work. 

With this loan, he will be able to improve the condition of his vehicle and continue offering his services safely without putting his life or the integrity of his cargo at risk.

Help Fernando with a loan today!

loans.use: to maintain and repair his truck.

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja en una hacienda ganadera, como encargado del corral, tiene 4 hijos, pero solo los últimos dos viven con ella y contribuyen con la economía del hogar. 

María, es una mujer hogareña, es por eso que decidió colocar un pequeño negocio en su casa; los productos que venden son: golosinas, comida típica, donas y otros productos de panadería, los cuales aprendió hacer tomando cursos de panadería, en su juventud.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar papas, tomate, repollo, carne molida, entre otros insumos. Todo esto es para aprovechar la época navideña, en la cual las ventas incrementan y dejan buenas ganancias.

El sueño de María es ampliar su negocio, de manera que pueda tener una fuente de ingresos segura, para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y brindarle a su familia mayores comodidades.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old. She studied through sixth grade. She is married, and her spouse works on a cattle ranch as a corral manager. She has 4 children, but only the last two live with her, and they contribute to the home economy.

María is a homemaker. That is why she decided to put a small business in her house. The products she sells include: candies, traditional dishes, donuts and other bakery products, which she learned to make by taking courses at a bakery when she was younger.

María needs the loan to buy potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, and ground beef, among other supplies. All of this is to take advantage of the Christmas season, in which her sales increase and she makes good profits. 

María’s dream is to expand her business so that she can have a secure source of income to cover all the home expenses and offer her family greater comforts.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, and ground beef, among other supplies.
